div1.head: βαβαί
div1.sense: Lat. papae! exclamation of surprise, bless me! Eur., Ar.

div1.head: βαβύκα
div1.etym: Lacon. for γέφυρα, Arist. ap. Plut.

div1.head: βάγμα
div1.sense: a speech, Aesch.

div1.head: βάδην
div1.sense: step by step, Lat. pedetentim, Il.; in marching step, Hdt.; β. ταχύ at quick step, Xen.
gradually, more and more, Ar.
walking, marching, opp. to riding, driving, sailing, Aesch.

div1.head: βαδίζω
div1.sense: to go slowly, to walk, Lat. ambulare, Hhymn., Xen.: to go, march, of horsemen, Xen.: to go by land, Dem.:—c. acc. cogn., βάδον, ὁδὸν β. Ar., Xen.
generally, ἐπʼ οἰκίας βαδ. to enter houses, Dem.: to proceed (in argument), Dem.:—of things, αἱ τιμαὶ ἐπʼ ἔλαττον ἐβάδιζον prices were getting lower, Dem.

div1.head: βάδισις
div1.sense: a walking, going, Ar.; of hares, Xen.

div1.head: βάδισμα
div1.sense: walk, gait, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: βαδιστέος
div1.sense: one must walk or go, Soph.:—so pl. βαδιστέα, Ar.

div1.head: βαδιστής
div1.sense: a goer, ταχὺς βαδ. a quick runner, Eur.

div1.head: βαδιστικός
div1.sense: good at walking, Ar.

div1.head: βάδος
div1.sense: a walk, βάδον βαδίζειν Ar.

div1.head: βάζω
div1.sense: to speak, say, Hom.; βάζειν τί τινα to say somewhat to a man, Il.; also, τί τινί Aesch.; c. dat. modi, χαλεποῖς βάζειν ἐπέεσσι to address with sharp words, Hes.:—Pass., ἔπος βέβακται a word has been spoken, Od.

div1.head: βαθμίς
div1.sense: a step, Anth.

div1.head: βαθμός
div1.sense: a step: metaph. a step, degree, NTest.

div1.head: βάθος
div1.sense: depth or height, acc. as measured up or down, Lat. altitudo, Ταρτάρου βάθη Aesch.; αἰθέρος βάθος Eur.: in military sense, the depth of a line of battle, Thuc., Xen.:— β. τριχῶν depth, i. e. thickness or length, of hair, Hdt.:—in NTest., τὸ βάθος the deep water.
metaph., κακῶν βάθος Aesch.; πλούτου βάθος Soph.

div1.head: βάθρον
div1.sense: that on which anything stands:
a base, pedestal, Hdt., Aesch.
a stage or scaffold, Hdt.
generally solid ground, Σαλαμῖνος β. Soph.; ὦ πατρῶιον ἑστίας βάθρον i. e. house of my father, Soph.:—in pl. foundations, Eur.; ἐν βάθροις εἶναι to stand firm, Eur.
a step, Soph.; the round of a ladder, Eur.
a bench, seat, Soph., Dem.
metaph., κινδύνου βάθρα the verge of danger, Eur.

div1.head: βαθυαγκής
div1.sense: with deep dells, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύβουλος
div1.sense: deep-counselling, Aesch.

div1.head: βαθύγειος
div1.sense: with deep soil, productive, βαθύγαιος Hdt.

div1.head: βαθυγήρως
div1.sense: in great old age, decrepit, Anth.

div1.head: βαθυδίνης
div1.sense: deep-eddying, Il., Hes.

div1.head: βαθύζωνος
div1.sense: deep-girded, i. e. girded not close under the breast, but over the hips, so that the gown fell over the girdle in folds (cf. βαθύκολπος), Hom.

div1.head: βαθύθριξ
div1.sense: of sheep, with thick wool, Hhymn.

div1.head: βαθυκαμπής
div1.sense: strongly curved, Anth.

div1.head: βαθυκήτης
div1.sense: deep yawning, of the sea, Theogn.

div1.head: βαθυκλεής
div1.sense: illustrious, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύκολπος
div1.sense: with dress falling in deep folds (cf. βαθύζωνος), of Trojan women, Il.
with deep, full breasts, deep-bosomed, Aesch.; of the earth, Pind.: cf. βαθύστερνος.

div1.head: βαθύκρημνος
div1.sense: with high cliffs, ἅλς Pind.; β. ἀκταί deep and rugged headlands, Pind.

div1.head: βαθυκτέανος
div1.sense: with great possessions, plenteous, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύλειμος
div1.sense: with deep, rich meadows, Il.

div1.head: βαθυλήϊος
div1.sense: with deep crop, very fruitful, Il.

div1.head: βαθύνοος
div1.sense: of deep mind, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύνω
div1.sense: to deepen, hollow out, of a torrent, Il.: to dig deep, NTest.
as military term, to deepen, τὴν φάλαγγα Xen.

div1.head: βαθύξυλος
div1.sense: with deep wood, Eur.

div1.head: βαθύπελμος
div1.sense: thick-soled, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύπλουτος
div1.sense: exceeding rich, Aesch.

div1.head: βαθυπόλεμος
div1.sense: plunged deep in war, Pind.

div1.head: βαθύρρηνος
div1.sense: with thick wool, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύρριζος
div1.sense: deep-rooted, Soph.

div1.head: βαθύρροος
div1.sense: deep-flowing, brimming, Il., Soph.

div1.head: βαθυσκαφής
div1.sense: deep-dug, Soph.

div1.head: βαθύσκιος
div1.sense: deep-shaded, Hhymn., Theocr.

div1.head: βαθύς
div1.sense: deep or high, acc. to oneʼs position, like Lat. altus, Hom., etc.; βαθέης αὐλῆς from high-fenced court, Il.; ἠιόνος προπάροιθε βαθείης the deep, i. e. wide, shore, Il.; in Prose, of a line of battle, Xen.
deep or thick in substance, of a mist, Hom.; of ploughed land, opp. to stony ground, Il., Eur.:— deep, thick, of woods, corn, clouds, Il., Hdt., etc.; of hair, Xen.
violent, of a storm, Il.
generally, large, copious, abundant, κλέος, κλῆρος Pind.; βαθεῖα τέρψις Soph.; βαθὺς ἀνήρ a rich man, Xen.; β. ὕπνος deep sleep, Theocr.
of the mind, deep, Il., Aesch.; βαθύτερα ἤθεα Hdt.
of Time, far-advanced, late, βαθὺς ὄρθρος (v. ὄρθρος) ; βαθὺ τῆς ἡλικίας Ar.; β. γῆρας Anth.
adv. βαθέως, Theocr.

div1.head: βαθύσπορος
div1.sense: deep-sown, fruitful, Eur.

div1.head: βαθύστερνος
div1.sense: deep-chested, λέων Pind., cf. βαθύκολπος.

div1.head: βαθύστολμος
div1.sense: with deep, full robe, Anth.

div1.head: βαθύστρωτος
div1.sense: deep-strewn, well-covered, Babr.

div1.head: βαθύσχοινος
div1.sense: deep-grown with rushes, Il.

div1.head: βαθύτης
div1.sense: = βάθος, depth, Luc.

div1.head: βαθύφυλλος
div1.sense: thick-leafed, Mosch.

div1.head: βαθυχαίτης
div1.sense: with deep, thick hair, Hes.

div1.head: βαίνω
div1.sense: in most forms,

intr. to walk, step, properly of motion on foot, ποσσὶ or ποσὶ βαίνειν Hom., etc.; c. inf. in Hom., βῆ ἰέναι, βῆ ἰέμεν set out to go, went his way, Il.; βῆ θέειν started to run, Il.; βῆ δʼ ἐλάαν, Il., etc.:—c. acc. loci, Soph.; and with all Preps. implying motion, as, ἐπὶ νηὸς ἔβαινεν was going on board ship, Od.; ἐφʼ ἵππων βάντες having mounted the chariot, Od.; βαίνειν διʼ αἵματος to wade through blood, Eur., etc.

in perf. to stand or be in a place, χῶρος ἐν ὧι βεβήκαμεν Soph.; often almost= εἰμί (sum), εὖ βεβηκώς on a good footing, well established, prosperous, Hdt., etc.; so, οἱ ἐν τέλει βεβῶτες they who are in office, Hdt., Soph.; cf. ξυρόν.
to go, go away, depart, Il., Soph.; βέβηκα euphem. for τέθνηκα, Aesch., Soph.:—of things, ἐννέα ἐνιαυτοὶ βεβάασι nine years have come and gone, Il.
to come, τίπτε βέβηκας; Il.: to arrive, Soph.
to go on, advance, ἐς τόδε τόλμης, ἐς τοσοῦτον ἐλπίδων Soph.
c. acc. to mount, Hom. only in aor1 mid., βήσασθαι δίφρον:— Pass., ἵπποι βαινόμεναι brood mares, Hdt.
χρέος ἔβα με debts came on me, Ar.
in Poets, with acc. of the instrument of motion, which is simply pleonastic, βαίνειν πόδα to advance the foot, step on, Eur., etc.
Causal, in fut. βήσω, aor1 ἔβησα:— to make to go, βῆσεν ἀφʼ ἵππον, ἐξ ἵππων βῆσε brought them down from the chariot, Il. The pres. in this sense is βιβάζω.

div1.head: βαιός
div1.sense: little, small, scanty, and of number, few, Pind., Aesch., Soph.; ἐχώρει βαιός he was going with scanty escort, i. e. alone, Soph.: of condition, low, mean, humble, Soph.: of time, short, Solon, Soph.:— neut. βαιόν, as adv. a little, Soph.; so pl. βαιά, Ar. Cf. ἠβαιός.

div1.head: βάϊς
div1.sense: a palm-branch, NTest.

div1.head: βαίτη
div1.sense: a shepherdʼs or peasantʼs coat of skins, Hdt., Theocr.

div1.head: βακέλας
div1.sense: an eunuch in the service of Cybele, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: βακίζω
div1.sense: to prophesy like Bacis, Ar.

div1.head: Βάκις
div1.sense: an old Boeotian prophet, Hdt.

div1.head: βάκλον
div1.sense: Lat. baculum, a stick, Aesop.

div1.head: βακτηρία
div1.sense: a staff, cane, Ar., Thuc.: borne as a badge of office by the δικασταί, Dem.

div1.head: βάκτρευμα
div1.sense: a staff, βακτρεύματα ποδός support lent to oneʼs foot, Eur.

div1.head: βακτρεύω
div1.sense: to lean on a staff.

div1.head: βάκτρον
div1.sense: Lat. baculus, a staff, stick, cudgel, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: βακτροπροσαίτης
div1.sense: going about begging with a staff, of a Cynic, Anth.

div1.head: βάκυλον
div1.sense: = βάκλον: pl. = Lat. fasces, Plut.

div1.head: Βακχάω
div1.sense: to be in Bacchic frenzy, to rave, Aesch.

div1.head: Βακχέβακχον
div1.sense: βακχέβακχον ἆισαι, to sing the song Βάκχε Βάκχε! Ar.

div1.head: Βακχεία
div1.sense: the feast of Bacchus, Bacchic frenzy, revelry, Aesch., Eur.: generally, frenzy, Plat.:—in pl. Bacchic orgies, Eur.

div1.head: Βακχεῖον
div1.sense: the temple of Bacchus, Ar.
Bacchic revelry, Eur.:—in pl. Bacchic orgies, Ar.; also Βάκχια, Eur.

div1.head: Βάκχειος
div1.sense: Bacchic, of or belonging to Bacchus and his rites, Eur., Xen.; frenzied, frenzy-stricken, Hdt., Soph.; τὸν B. ἄνακτα, of Aeschylus, Ar.
as Subst., Βάκχιος, ὁ, Βάκχος, Soph., Eur.
= οἶνος, Eur.
Βάκχειος (sc. πούς), a foot of three syllables, ˘ ˘ ¯ opp. to antibacchius.

div1.head: Βάκχευμα
div1.sense: in pl. Bacchic revelries, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: Βακχεύσιμος
div1.sense: Bacchanalian, frenzied, Eur.

div1.head: Βάκχευσις
div1.sense: Bacchic revelry, Eur.

div1.head: Βακχευτής
div1.sense: a Bacchanal: as adj. Bacchanalian, Anth.

div1.head: Βακχευτικός
div1.sense: disposed to Bacchic revels, Arist.

div1.head: Βακχεύω
div1.sense: to keep the feast of Bacchus, celebrate his mysteries, Hdt.
to speak or act like one frantic, Lat. bacchari, Soph., Eur.
Causal, to inspire with frenzy, Eur.:—Pass., Eur.

div1.head: Βάκχη
div1.sense: a Bacchante, Aesch., Soph., etc.:—generally, Βάκχη Ἅιδου frantic handmaid of Hades, Eur.; β. νεκύων Eur.

div1.head: Βάκχος
div1.etym: The Root seems to be !ϝαχ, so that Βάκχος represents ϝάκχος; and Ἴακχος is for ϝίϝακχος; prob. from ἰάχω, = ϝιϝάχω, to shout
div1.sense: Bacchus, a later name of Dionysus, Soph., etc.: called Διόνυσος Βάκχειος and ὁ Βάκχειος in Hdt.
as appellat. wine, Eur., etc.
a Bacchanal, any one inspired, frantic, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: βαλανάγρα
div1.sense: a key or hook for pulling out the doorpin, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: βαλανεῖον
div1.sense: Lat. balineum, balneum, a bath or bathing-room, Ar.; in pl., Ar.

div1.head: βαλανεύς
div1.sense: a bath-man, Lat. balneator .

div1.head: βαλανεύω
div1.sense: to wait upon a person at the bath, β. ἑαυτῶι to be oneʼs own bath-man, Ar.

div1.head: βαλανηφάγος
div1.sense: acorn-eating, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: βαλανηφόρος
div1.sense: bearing dates, Hdt.

div1.head: βαλανίζω
div1.sense: βαλανίζω δρῦν, to shake acorns from the oak: as a proverb. answer to beggars, ἄλλην δρῦν βαλάνιζε Anth.

div1.head: βαλάνισσα
div1.sense: a bathing-woman, Anth.

div1.head: βαλανοδόκη
div1.sense: the socket in a door-post to receive the βάλανος (II).

div1.head: βάλανος
div1.sense: an acorn, Lat. glans, the fruit of the φηγός, given to swine, Od.:— any similar fruit, the date, Hdt., Xen.

from similarity of shape, an iron peg, a bolt-pin, Lat. pessulus, passed through the wooden bar (μοχλός) into the door-post, so that the bar could not be removed till the pin was taken out with a hook (βαλανάγρα), Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: βαλανόω
div1.sense: to fasten with a bolt-pin (βάλανος II), βεβαλάνωκε τὴν θύραν Ar.:—Pass., βεβαλανωμένος, η, ον, shut close, secured, Ar.

div1.head: βαλβίς
div1.sense: properly, the rope drawn across the race-course: mostly in pl., Lat. carceres, the posts marking the line whence the racers started, and to which they returned, Ar.:—then, any starting point, Eur., Ar.; metaph., πρὸς βαλβῖδα βίου Eur.
also any point to be gained, as the battlements (by one scaling a wall), Soph.

div1.head: Βαλίος
div1.sense: parox. Βαλίος, one of the horses of Achilles, dapple, Il.

div1.head: βαλιός
div1.sense: spotted, dappled, Eur.

div1.head: βαλλάντιον
div1.sense: a bag, pouch, purse, Simon., Ar.

div1.head: βαλλαντιοτομέω
div1.sense: to cut purses, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: βαλλαντιοτόμος
div1.sense: a cut-purse, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: Βαλλήναδε
div1.sense: Βαλλήναδε βλέπειν, a pun between βάλλω and the Attic deme Παλλήνη, Ar.

div1.head: βαλλήν
div1.sense: a king, Aesch.

div1.head: βάλλω
div1.sense: Act. to throw:

with acc. of person or thing aimed at, to throw so as to hit, to hit one with a missile, opp. to striking (τύπτω, οὐτάω) , βλήμενος ἠὲ τυπείς Il.; c. dupl. acc. pers. et partis, μιν βάλε μηρὸν ὀϊστῶι Il.: c. acc. cogn. added, ἕλκος, τό μιν βάλε the wound which he gave him, Il.:—also, βάλε κατʼ ἀσπίδα smote upon it, Il.
of things, ἡνίοχον ῥαθάμιγγες ἔβαλλον Il.; of the Sun, ἀκτῖσιν ἔβαλλεν χθόνα Od.: to strike the senses, of sound, κτύπος οὔατα βάλλει Il.
metaph., β. τινὰ κακοῖς to smite with reproaches, Soph., etc.; φθόνος βάλλει τινά Aesch.

with acc. of the weapon thrown, to throw, cast, hurl, βαλὼν βέλος Il; ἐν νηυσὶν πῦρ βάλλειν Il.:—with dat. of the weapon, to throw or shoot with a thing, χερμαδίοισι Il.; βέλεσι β. τινα Hom.; β. ἐπί τινα to throw at one, Thuc.; ἐπὶ σκοπόν or σκοποῦ Xen.

generally of anything thrown, εἰς ἅλα λύματʼ ἔβαλλον Il., etc.:—of persons, β. τινὰ ἐν κονίηισιν, ἐν δαπέδωι Hom., etc.; metaph., ἐς κακὸν β. τινά Od.; β. τινὰ ἐς φόβον Eur.; also, ἐν αἰτίαι or αἰτία β. τινά Soph.
to let fall, ἑτέρωσε κάρη βάλεν Il.; β. ἀπὸ δάκρυ παρειῶν Od.
of the eyes, ἑτέρωσε βάλʼ ὄμματα cast them the other way, Od., etc.

in a loose sense, to throw, to put, place, ἐν στήθεσσι μένος βάλε Il.; ὅπως φιλότητα μετʼ ἀμφοτέροισι βάλωμεν may put frienship between them, Il.; β. τί τινι ἐν θυμῶι Od.; ἐς θυμὸν β. to lay to heart, Soph.
to put round, ἀμφʼ ὀχέεσσι βάλε κύκλα Il.; and of clothes or arms, ἀμφὶ δʼ Ἀθήνη ὤμοις βάλʼ αἰγίδα Il.
βαλών is sometimes added, like λαβών or ἔχων, at the end of a sentence, almost as an expletive, with, Soph.
intr., ποταμὸς εἰς ἅλα βάλλων falling, Il.; ἐν πέδωι βαλῶ (sc. ἐμαυτήν) Aesch.
so in familiar language, βάλλʼ ἐς κόρακας away with you! be hanged! Lat. pasce corvos! abi in malam rem! Ar.
Mid. to put for oneself, ἐνὶ θυμῶι βάλλευ lay it to heart, Od.; ἐς θυμὸν βάλλεσθαί τι Hdt.; ἐφʼ ἑωυτοῦ βαλόμενος on oneʼs own judgment, of oneself, Hdt.
τόξα or ξίφος ἀμφʼ ὤμοις βάλλεσθαι to throw about oneʼs shoulder, Il.
ἐς γαστέρα βάλλεσθαι, of a woman, to conceive, Hdt.
to lay the foundations of, begin to form, οἰκοδομίαν, στρατόπεδον, Plat., etc.; β. ἄγκυραν to cast anchor, Hdt.
rarely, χρόα βάλλεσθαι λουτροῖς to dash oneʼs flesh with water, bathe, Hhymn.

div1.head: βαμβαίνω
div1.sense: to chatter with the teeth, Il.: to stammer, Bion.

div1.head: βάμμα
div1.sense: that in which a thing is dipped, dye, Plat., v. βάπτω I. 3.

div1.head: βαναυσία
div1.sense: handicraft, the practice of a mere mechanical art, Hdt.

div1.head: βαναυσικός
div1.sense: of or for mechanics: τέχνη β. a mere mechanical art, Lat. ars sellularia, Xen.

div1.head: βάναυσος
div1.sense: mechanical, and as Subst. a mechanic, Arist.
τέχνη βάναυσος a mere mechanical art, a base, ignoble art, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: βαναυσουργία
div1.sense: handicraft, Plut.

div1.head: βάξις
div1.sense: a saying, esp. an oracular saying, like φήμη, Aesch., Soph.
a report, rumour, Theogn., Soph., Eur.; ἁλώσιμος β. tidings of the capture, Aesch.

div1.head: βαπτίζω
div1.sense: to dip in or under water; metaph., βεβαπτισμένοι soaked in wine, Plat.; ὀφλήμασι βεβ. over head and ears in debt, Plut.
to baptize, τινά NTest.:—Pass., βαπτίζεσθαι εἰς μετάνοιαν, εἰς ἄφεσιν ἁμαρτιῶν NTest.:—Mid. to get oneself baptized, NTest.

div1.head: βάπτισμα
div1.sense: baptism, NTest.

div1.head: βαπτισμός
div1.sense: a dipping in water, ablution, NTest.

div1.head: βαπτιστής
div1.sense: one that dips: a baptizer, ὁ B. the baptist, NTest.

div1.head: βαπτός
div1.sense: dipped, dyed, bright-coloured, Ar.
for dyeing, χρώματα Plat.
of water, drawn by dipping vessels (cf. βάπτω I. 3), Eur.

div1.head: βάπτω
div1.sense: trans. to dip in water, Lat. immergere, Od., Plat.:—of slaughter, ἐν σφαγαῖσι βάψασα ξίφος Aesch.; ἔβαψας ἔγχος Soph.; φάσγανον εἴσω σαρκὸς ἔβαψεν Eur.
to dip in poison, ἰούς, χιτῶνα Soph.
to dip in dye, to dye, Hdt., Aesch.:—Comic, βάπτειν τινὰ βάμμα Σαρδιανικόν to dye one in the [red] dye of Sardis, i. e. give him a bloody coxcomb, Ar.
to draw water by dipping a vessel, Theocr.; βάψασα ἁλός (sc. τὸ τεῦχος) having dipped it so as to draw water from the sea, Eur.
intr., ναῦς ἔβαψεν the ship dipped, sank, Eur.

div1.head: βᾶ
div1.sense: king! Aesch.

div1.head: βάραθρον
div1.sense: a gulf, pit:— at Athens a cleft behind the Acropolis, into which criminals were thrown, Hdt., Ar.
metaph. ruin, perdition, Dem.

div1.head: βαρβαρίζω
div1.sense: to behave like a barbarian, speak like one, Hdt.: to speak broken Greek, speak gibberish, Plat.
to hold with the barbarians, i. e. the Persians, Xen.

div1.head: βαρβαρικός
div1.sense: barbaric, foreign, like a foreigner, opp. to Ἑλληνικός, Simon.; τὸ βαρβαρικόν, οἱ βάρβαροι, Thuc.; esp. of the Persians, Xen.:—adv., βαρβαρικῶς καὶ Ἑλληνικῶς i. e. both in Persian and Greek, Thuc.

div1.head: βαρβαρισμός
div1.sense: barbarism, Arist.

div1.head: βαρβαρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become barbarous, Eur.; βεβαρβαρωμένος of barbarous or outlandish sound, Soph.

div1.head: βάρβαρος
div1.sense: barbarous, i. e. not Greek, foreign, known to Hom., as appears from the word βαρβαρόφωνος in Il.:—as Subst. βάρβαροι, οἱ, originally all that were not Greeks, specially the Medes and Persians, Hdt., Attic: so the Hebrews called the rest of mankind Gentiles. From the Augustan age however the name was given by the Romans to all tribes which had no Greek or Roman accomplishments.
after the Persian war the word took the sense of outlandish, ἀμαθὴς καὶ βάρβαρος Ar.; βαρβαρώτατος Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: βαρβαρόφωνος
div1.sense: speaking a foreign tongue, Κᾶρες Il.

div1.head: βάρβιτος
div1.sense: a musical instrument of many strings (πολύχορδος Theocr.), like the lyre, and often used for the lyre itself, Anacr., Eur., etc.

div1.head: βάρδιστος
div1.etym: by Epic metath. for βράδιστος, Sup.of βραδύς, Il.

div1.head: βαρέω
div1.sense: to weigh down, depress, Luc.
intr. in Epic perf. part. βεβαρηώς, weighed down, heavy, οἴνωι βεβαρηότες Od.: later in part. pass. βεβαρημένος, Theocr., Anth., etc.

div1.head: βᾶρις
div1.sense: a flat-bottomed boat, used in Egypt, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: βάρος
div1.sense: weight, Hdt., etc.
a weight, burden, load, Aesch., etc.
metaph. a heavy weight, πημονῆς, συμφορᾶς β. Soph.; then alone for grief, misery, Aesch.; βάρος ἔχειν Arist.
abundance, πλούτου, ὄλβου Eur.

div1.head: βαρυάλγητος
div1.sense: very grievous, Soph.

div1.head: βαρυαχής
div1.sense: heavy with woe, Soph.

div1.head: βαρυβρεμέτης
div1.sense: loud-thundering, Soph.

div1.head: βαρύβρομος
div1.sense: loud-roaring, loud-sounding, Eur.

div1.head: βαρυβρώς
div1.sense: gnawing, corroding, Soph.

div1.head: βαρύγουνος
div1.sense: heavy-kneed, lazy, Call.

div1.head: βαρύγυιος
div1.sense: weighing down the limbs, wearisome, Anth.

div1.head: βαρυδαιμονέω
div1.sense: to be grievously unlucky, Ar.

div1.head: βαρυδαίμων
div1.sense: pressed by a heavy fate, luckless, Eur.

div1.head: βαρύδακρυς
div1.sense: weeping grievously, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύδικος
div1.sense: taking heavy vengeance, Aesch.

div1.head: βαρυδότειρα
div1.sense: giver of ill gifts, Aesch.

div1.head: βαρύδουπος
div1.sense: loud-sounding, Mosch.

div1.head: βαρύζηλος
div1.sense: exceeding jealous, Anth.

div1.head: βαρυηχής
div1.sense: deep-voiced, Ar.

div1.head: βαρύθροος
div1.sense: deep or loud-sounding, Mosch.

div1.head: βαρυθυμέω
div1.sense: to be weighed down: to be heavy at heart: in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: βαρυθυμία
div1.sense: sullenness, Plut.

div1.head: βαρύθυμος
div1.sense: heavy in spirit: indignant, sullen, Eur.

div1.head: βαρύθω
div1.sense: to be weighed down, Il., Hes.
to be heavy, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύκοτος
div1.sense: heavy in wrath, Aesch.

div1.head: βαρύκτυπος
div1.sense: heavy-sounding, loud-thundering, Hhymn., Hes.

div1.head: βαρύμηνις
div1.sense: heavy in wrath, exceeding wrathful, Aesch.

div1.head: βαρύμισθος
div1.sense: largely paid, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύμοχθος
div1.sense: very toilsome, painful, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύνω
div1.sense: to weigh down, oppress by weight, depress, Hom.:—Pass., γυῖα βαρύνεται he is heavy, i. e. weary, in limb, Il.; χεῖρα βαρυνθείς disabled in hand, Il.; βαρύνεταί τινι τὸ σκέλος Ar.; ὄμμα β., of one dying, Eur.
metaph. to oppress, weary, τοὺς δικαστάς Xen.:—Pass. to be oppressed, distressed, Lat. gravari, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: βαρυόργητος
div1.sense: exceeding angry, Anth.

div1.head: βαρυπάλαμος
div1.sense: heavy-handed, Pind.

div1.head: βαρυπενθής
div1.sense: causing grievous woe, Anth.

div1.head: βαρυπένθητος
div1.sense: mourning heavily, Anth.

div1.head: βαρυπεσής
div1.sense: heavy-falling, Aesch.

div1.head: βαρύποτμος
div1.sense: of persons, Soph.; of sufferings, grievous, Soph.

div1.head: βαρύπους
div1.sense: heavy at the end, Anth.

div1.head: βαρυσίδηρος
div1.sense: heavy with iron, Plut.

div1.head: βαρύς
div1.etym: poet. gen. pl. fem. βαρεῶν for βαρειῶν
div1.sense: heavy in weight, opp. to κοῦφος, Hdt., etc.: in Hom. mostly with a notion of strength and force, χεῖρα βαρεῖαν Il., etc.: also, heavy with age or suffering, γήραι, νόσωι Soph.

heavy to bear, grievous, Hom.; βαρὺ or βαρέα στενάχειν to sob heavily, Hom.:—in Attic, burdensome, grievous, oppressive:— adv., βαρέως φέρειν τι to take a thing ill, Lat. graviter ferre, Hdt., etc.; βαρέως ἀκούειν to hear with disgust, Xen.
violent, Theocr., Plat., etc.
weighty, impressive, NTest.
of persons, severe, stern, Aesch., Soph.:—also, wearisome, oppressive, Eur., Dem.: in good sense, grave, dignified, Arist.
of soldiers, heavy-armed, Xen.
of impressions on the senses,
of sound, strong, deep, bass, Od., Aesch., Soph.
of smell, strong, offensive, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: βαρύσταθμος
div1.sense: weighing heavy, Ar.

div1.head: βαρύστονος
div1.sense: groaning heavily, bellowing, Dem.:—adv. -νως, Aesch.
of things, heavily lamented, grievous, Soph.

div1.head: βαρυσφάραγος
div1.sense: loud-thundering, Pind.

div1.head: βαρύτης
div1.sense: weight, heaviness, Thuc.
of men, importunity, disagreeableness, Dem., Plut.
in good sense, gravity, dignity, Arist., Plut.
of sound, strength, depth, Plat.

div1.head: βαρύτιμος
div1.sense: very costly, NTest.

div1.head: βαρύτλητος
div1.sense: bearing a heavy weight, Anth.
pass. ill to bear, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύτονος
div1.sense: deep-sounding, Xen.

div1.head: βαρύφθογγος
div1.sense: loud-sounding, roaring, Hhymn.

div1.head: βαρυφροσύνη
div1.sense: gloominess, indignation, Plut.

div1.head: βαρύφρων
div1.sense: weighty of purpose, grave-minded, Theocr.

div1.head: βαρύχειλος
div1.sense: thick-lipped, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύχορδος
div1.sense: deep-toned, Anth.

div1.head: βαρύψυχος
div1.sense: heavy of soul, dejected, Soph.

div1.head: βασανίζω
div1.sense: to rub gold upon the touch-stone (βάσανος), Plat.: hence, to try the genuineness of a thing, to put to the test, make proof of, Plat.
of persons, to examine closely, cross-question, Hdt., Ar.
to question by applying torture, to torture, Ar.:—Pass. to be put to the torture, for the purpose of extorting confession, Thuc.: to be tormented by disease or storm, NTest.

div1.head: βασανιστέος
div1.sense: to be put to the proof, Plat.
βασανιστέον one must put to the torture, τινά Plat., Dem.

div1.head: βασανιστής
div1.sense: questioner, torturer, tormentor, Dem., NTest.

div1.head: βασανίστρια
div1.sense: an examiner, Ar.

div1.head: βάσανος
div1.sense: the touch-stone, Lat. lapis Lydius, a dark-coloured stone on which pure gold, when rubbed, leaves a peculiar mark, Theogn.: hence.
generally, a test, trial whether a thing be genuine or real, Hdt., Soph.
inquiry by torture, the "question, " torture, used to extort evidence from slaves, Oratt.
torture of disease, NTest.

div1.head: βασίλεια
div1.sense: a queen, princess, Od., Aesch.

div1.head: βασιλεία
div1.sense: a kingdom, dominion, Hdt.: hereditary monarchy, opp. to τυραννίς, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: βασιλείδιον
div1.sense: a petty king, Plut.

div1.head: βασίλειον
div1.sense: a kingly dwelling, palace, Xen. mostly in pl., Hdt., etc.
the royal treasury, Hdt.

div1.head: βασίλειος
div1.sense: of the king, kingly, royal, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: βασιλεύς
div1.sense: a king, chief, Hom.: later it was an hereditary king, opp. to τύραννος, Hdt., Attic; ἄναξ β. lord king, Aesch.: c. gen., β. νεῶν Aesch.; οἰωνῶν β., of the eagle, Aesch.:—Hom. has a comp. βασιλεύτερος more of a king, more kingly, Sup. βασιλεύτατος most kingly.
of the kingʼs son, prince, or any one sharing in the government, Od.
generally, a lord, master, householder, Il., Pind.
at Athens, the second of the nine Archons was called βασιλεύς; he had charge of the public worship, and the conduct of criminal processes, Plat., etc.
after the Persian war, the king of Persia was called βασιλεύς (without the Art.), Hdt., Attic; more rarely ὁ βασιλεύς, or ὁ μέγας βας. Hdt.

div1.head: βασιλεύω
div1.sense: to be king, to rule, reign, Hom., etc.; of a woman, to be queen, Hom.; c. gen. to be king of, Od.; also, ὄφρʼ Ἰθάκης κατὰ δῆμον βασιλεύοι Od.; in aor. to have become king, Hdt.; c. dat. to be king among others, Od.:—Pass. to be governed by a king, Plat.: to submit to the king, Plut.
to be master of a thing, c. gen., Theocr.

div1.head: βασιληΐς
div1.sense: royal, Il., Eur.

div1.head: βασιλίζω
div1.sense: to be of the kingʼs party, Plut.

div1.head: βασιλικός
div1.sense: royal, kingly, Hdt., Attic
like a king, kingly, princely, βασιλικώτατος Xen.:—adv., βασιλικῶς as a king, with kingly authority, Hdt.
as Subst.,
βασιλική (sub. στοά), a colonnade at Athens, Plat.; v. στοά.
βασιλικός, ὁ, kingʼs officer, NTest.

div1.head: βασιλίς
div1.sense: a queen, princess, Soph., Eur., etc.
as adj. royal, Eur.

div1.head: βάσιμος
div1.sense: passable, accessible, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: βάσις
div1.sense: a stepping, step, and collectively steps, Aesch., Soph., etc.; οὐκ ἔχων βάσιν power to step, Soph.; τροχῶν βάσεις the rolling of the wheels, Soph.
that with which one steps, a foot, Eur., NTest.
that whereon one stands, a base, Plat.

div1.head: βασκαίνω
div1.sense: c. acc. to slander, malign, belie, disparage, Dem.
c. dat. to envy, grudge, Dem.
to bewitch, by means of spells: Pass., ὡς μὴ βασκανθῶ (aor1 subj.) that I be not bewitched, Theocr.

div1.head: βασκανία
div1.sense: slander, envy, malice, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: βάσκανος
div1.sense: slanderous, envious, malignant, Ar., Dem.
as Subst. a slanderer, Dem.
a sorcerer, Dem.

div1.head: βασκάς
div1.sense: a kind of duck, Ar.

div1.head: βάσκω
div1.etym: akin to βαίνω, cf. χάσκω, χαίνω
div1.sense: βάσκʼ ἴθι speed thee! away! Il.; also come! Aesch.

div1.head: βασσάρα
div1.sense: a fox.
a Thracian bacchanal, Anth.

div1.head: βασσάριον
div1.sense: a little fox, Hdt.

div1.head: βάσταγμα
div1.sense: that which is borne, a burden, Eur.

div1.head: βαστάζω
div1.sense: to lift, lift up, raise, Od., Soph., Eur.: to bear, carry, support, Aesch., Soph.
to hold in oneʼs hands, Soph.
βαστάζειν ἐν γνώμηι to bear in mind, consider, weigh, make proof of, Aesch.
to carry off, take away, NTest.
Attic also = ψηλαφάω, to touch, Aesch.

div1.head: βαστακτός
div1.sense: to be borne, Anth.

div1.head: βάταλος
div1.sense: a nickname given to Demosthenes, from his stuttering, Aeschin.

div1.head: βατέω
div1.sense: to tread, cover, of animals, Theocr.

div1.head: βατηρίς
div1.sense: κλῖμαξ β. a mounting ladder, Anth.

div1.head: βατιδοσκόπος
div1.sense: looking after skates, Ar.

div1.head: βατίς
div1.sense: a flat fish, perhaps the skate, Ar.

div1.head: βατοδρόπος
div1.sense: pulling berries off, Hhymn.

div1.head: βάτος
div1.sense: a bramble-bush or wild raspberry, Od.

div1.head: βάτος2
div1.sense: the Hebrew measure bath, = Attic μετρητής, NTest.

div1.head: βατός
div1.sense: passable, Xen.

div1.head: βατράχειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to a frog: βατράχεια (sc. χρώματα), frog-colour, pale-green, Ar.

div1.head: βατραχίς
div1.sense: a frog-green coat, Ar.

trans.i: the battle of the frogs and mice

div1.head: βάτραχος
div1.sense: a frog, Batr., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: βατταρίζω
div1.sense: to stutter, Luc.

div1.head: βαττολογέω
div1.sense: to speak stammeringly, say the same thing over and over again, NTest.

div1.head: Βάττος
div1.sense: stammerer, name of a king of Cyrene, Hdt.

div1.head: βαΰζω
div1.sense: to cry βαά βαά, to bark, Theocr.: of angry persons, to snarl, yelp, Aesch.; trans. to shriek aloud for, τινά Aesch.

div1.head: βαύκαλις
div1.sense: a wine-cooler, Anth.

div1.head: βαυκοπανοῦργος
div1.sense: a paltry braggart, Arist.

div1.head: βαυκός
div1.sense: prudish.

div1.head: βαφή
div1.sense: a dipping of red-hot iron in water, the temper produced thereby, Arist.
a dipping in dye, dyeing, dye, Aesch., Plat., etc.; κρόκου βαφαί the saffron- dyed robe, Aesch.; βαφαὶ ὕδρας the robe dipped in the hydraʼs blood, Eur.
χαλκοῦ βαφαί, in Aesch., is prob. the art of tempering brass, to express something which no woman could know.
in Soph. Aj., βαφῆι σίδηρος ὥς must be construed not with ἐθηλύνθην, but with the preceding words καρτερὸς γενόμενος, for iron becomes harder, not softer, by being dipped.

div1.head: βαφικός
div1.sense: fit for dyeing, Luc.

div1.head: βδάλλω
div1.sense: to milk cows, Plat.: to suck, Arist.

div1.head: βδέλλα
div1.sense: a leech, Hdt., Theocr.

div1.head: βδέλυγμα
div1.sense: an abomination, i. e. an idol, NTest.

div1.head: βδελυγμία
div1.sense: nausea, disgust, Xen.

div1.head: βδελυκτός
div1.sense: disgusting, abominable, NTest.

div1.head: βδελυρεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to behave in a brutal manner, Dem.

div1.head: βδελυρία
div1.sense: brutal conduct, want of shame and decency, brutality, Oratt.

div1.head: βδελυρός
div1.sense: loathsome, disgusting, brutal, Ar., Oratt.; Sup. -ώτατος, Dem.

div1.head: βδελύσσομαι
div1.sense: to feel nausea, to be sick, Ar.
c. acc. to feel a loathing at, to loath, Ar.
to be loathsome: οἱ ἐβδελυγμένοι the abominable (in ref. to βδέλυγμα), NTest.

div1.head: βδέω
div1.sense: to break wind, Ar.

div1.head: βδύλλω
div1.sense: Lat. oppedere, to insult grossly, τινά Ar.
to be afraid of, Ar.

div1.head: βέβαιος
div1.sense: firm, steady, steadfast, sure, certain, Aesch., etc.; βεβαιότερος κίνδυνος a surer game, Thuc.
of persons, steadfast, steady sure, constant, Aesch., etc.; c. inf., βεβαιότεροι μηδὲν νεωτεριεῖν more certain to make no change, Thuc.
τὸ βέβαιον certainty, firmness, resolution, Hdt., Thuc.
adv. -ως, Aesch., etc.; comp. -ότερον, Thuc.; Sup. -ότατα, Thuc.

div1.head: βεβαιότης
div1.sense: firmness, steadfastness, stability, assurance, certainty, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: βεβαιόω
div1.sense: to make firm, confirm, establish, secure, warrant, make good, Plat., Xen.; ἔργωι βεβαιούμενα things warranted by fact, opp. to ἀκοῆι λεγόμενα, Thuc.
β. τί τινι to secure one the possession of a thing, Thuc.:—Mid. to establish for oneself, to confirm, secure, Thuc.
Mid. also to secure oneʼs ground in argument, to asseverate, maintain, make good, Plat.
to guarantee a title, Isae.

div1.head: βεβαίωσις
div1.sense: confirmation, Thuc., Aeschin.

div1.head: βέβηλος
div1.etym: βηλός, with βε- as a redupl.
div1.sense: allowable to be trodden, permitted to human use, Lat. profanus, Soph., Eur.; ἐν βεβήλωι Thuc.
of persons, unhallowed, impure, Thuc., Plat.: c. gen. uninitiated in rites, Anth.

div1.head: βεβηλόω
div1.sense: to profane, NTest.

div1.head: βεβόλημαι
div1.sense: to be stricken with grief, Hom.; βεβολήατο Epic 3rd pl. plup.

div1.head: βεβουλευμένως
div1.sense: advisedly, designedly, Dem.

div1.head: βεκκεσέληνος
div1.etym: A word coined from the story about βέκος in Hdt. 2. 2, and the Arcadian claim of being προσέληνοι.
div1.sense: superannuated, doting, Ar.

div1.head: βεκός
div1.sense: bread, a Phrygian word, Hdt.

div1.head: βελεηφόρος
div1.sense: bearing darts, Anth.

div1.head: βέλεμνον
div1.sense: poet. for βέλος, a dart, javelin, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: βελεσσιχαρής
div1.sense: in darts, Anth.

div1.head: βελόνη
div1.sense: any sharp point, a needle, Batr., Aeschin.

div1.head: βελονοπώλης
div1.sense: a needle-seller, Ar.

div1.head: βέλος
div1.etym: βάλλω, as Lat. jaculum from jacio
div1.sense: a missile, esp. an arrow, dart, bolt, Hom.; of the rock hurled by the Cyclops, Od.; of the oxʼs leg thrown at Ulysses, Od.; ὑπὲκ βελέων out of the reach of darts, out of shot, Il.; so ἔξω βελῶν Xen.
like ἔγχος, used of any weapon, as a sword, Ar.: an axe, Eur.
the ἀγανὰ βέλεα of Apollo and Artemis in Hom. always denote the sudden, easy death of men and women respectively.

after Hom. of anything swift-darting, Ζηνὸς βέλη the bolts of Zeus, thunderbolts, Aesch.; πύρπνουν β. Aesch.; βέλη πάγων the piercing frosts, Soph.:—metaph., ὀμμάτων βέλος the glance of the eye, Aesch.; ἱμέρου βέλος the shaft of love, Aesch.; of arguments, πᾶν τετόξευται βέλος Aesch.

div1.head: βελοσφενδόνη
div1.sense: a dart wrapped with pitch and tow, and thrown while on fire, Plut.

div1.head: βέλτερος
div1.etym: Prob. from same Root as βούλομαι.
poet. comp. and superl. of ἀγαθός
div1.sense: better, more excellent, βέλτερόν ἐστι it is better, c. inf., Hom.; in Theogn., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: βέλτιστος
div1.sense: best, Ar., Plat., etc.:— ὦ βέλτιστε or βέλτιστε, a common mode of address, my good friend, Ar., etc.:— τὸ βέλτιστον the best, what is best, Aesch., Plat.:— οἱ βέλτιστοι or τὸ βέλτιστον the aristocracy, Lat. optimates, Xen.

div1.head: βελτίων
div1.sense: better, ἐπὶ τὸ βέλτιον χωρεῖν to improve, advance, Thuc.

div1.head: βεμβικιάω
div1.sense: to spin like a top, Ar.

div1.head: βεμβικίζω
div1.sense: to set a spinning, Ar.

div1.head: βέμβιξ
div1.sense: Lat. turbo, a top spun by whipping, Ar.

div1.head: Βενδίδεια
div1.sense: the festival of Bendis, Plat.

div1.head: Βενδίδειον
div1.sense: the temple of Bendis, Xen.

div1.head: Βενδῖς
div1.sense: the Thracian Artemis, Luc.

div1.head: βένθος
div1.etym: poet. for βάθος, as πένθος for πάθος
div1.sense: the depth of the sea, Hom.; also in pl., θαλάσσης βένθεα, ἐν βένθεσσιν ἁλός Il., Hom.:—also of a wood, βένθεσιν ὕλης Od.

div1.head: βέομαι
div1.etym: Homeric fut. with no pres. in use
div1.sense: I shall live (akin to βιόω):— others regard it Epic fut. of βαίνω.

div1.head: Βερέσχεθοι
div1.sense: a booby, Ar.

div1.head: βηλός
div1.sense: that on which one treads, the threshold, Lat. limen, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: βῆμα
div1.sense: a step, pace, stride, Hhymn., Aesch., Eur.; Διὸς εὔφρονι βήματι under the kindly guidance of Zeus, Soph.
= βάθρον, a step, seat, Soph.:— a raised place or tribune to speak from in a public assembly or law-court, Thuc., Oratt.

div1.head: βήξ
div1.sense: a cough, Thuc.

div1.head: βῆ
div1.sense: baa, the cry of sheep, Cratin.

div1.head: βῆσσα
div1.sense: a wooded comb or glen, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: βησσήεις
div1.sense: of or like a glen, wooded, Hes.

div1.head: βήσσω
div1.sense: to cough, Hdt.

div1.head: βῆτα
div1.sense: Β, β, , indecl., second letter of the Gr. alphabet: hence as numeral, βʼ δύο, δεύτερος, ,β 2.
β is the medial labial mute, between tenuis τ and asp. θ. The dialectic variations of β seem to be mostly due to uncertainties of pronunciation:
for γ, as βλήχων γληχών, βλέφαρον Doric γλέφαρον, βουνός γουνός· βεμβράς for μεμβράς, βροτός for μορτός (mortalis).
β is sometimes inserted between μλ, μρ to give a fuller sound, as in ἄμβροτος, μεσημβρία, γαμβρός, μέμβλεται.

div1.head: βητάρμων
div1.sense: a dancer, Od.

div1.head: βιάζω
div1.sense: to constrain, Od.:—Pass., aor1 ἐβιάσθην, perf. βεβίασμαι:— to be hard pressed or overpowered, Il.; βιάζομαι τάδε I suffer violence herein, Soph.; βιασθείς Soph.; ἐπεὶ ἐβιάσθη Thuc.; βεβιασμένοι forcibly made slaves, Xen.:—of things, τοὔνειδος βιασθέν forced from one, Soph.

Mid. βιάζομαι, with aor1 mid. ἐβιασάμην, perf. βεβίασμαι:— to overpower by force, press hard, Hom.; βιάζεσθαι νόμους to do them violence, Thuc.;— β. αὑτόν to lay violent hands on oneself, Plat.:— β. τινα, c. inf., to force one to do, Xen.; and inf. omitted, β. τὰ σφάγια to force the victims [to be favourable], Hdt.
c. acc. rei, βιάζεσθαι τὸν ἔκπλουν to force the entrance, Thuc.
absol. to use force, struggle, Aesch., Soph., etc.: to force oneʼs way, Thuc., Xen.; c. inf., β. πρὸς τὸν λόφον ἐλθεῖν Thuc.: of a famine, to increase in violence, Hdt.

div1.head: βιαιομάχας
div1.sense: fighting violently, Anth.

div1.head: βίαιος
div1.sense: forcible, violent, ἔργα βίαια Od.; β. θάνατος a violent death, Hdt., Plat., etc.; ὁ πόλεμος β. διδάσκαλος is a teacher of violence, Thuc.:—adv., βιαίως by force, perforce, Od., Aesch., etc.; so, πρὸς τὸ βίαιον Aesch.
pass. constrained, compulsory, Plat.

div1.head: βία
div1.sense: bodily strength, force, power, might, Hom., etc.; periphr. βίη Ἡρακληείη the strength of Hercules, i. e. the strong Hercules, Il.; βίη Διομήδεος Il.; Τυδέως βία, Πολυνείκους β. Aesch., etc.
of the mind, Il.

force, an act of violence, Od.; in pl., Od.; in Attic, βίαι τινός against oneʼs will, in spite of him, Aesch., Thuc., etc.; βίαι φρενῶν Aesch.; also βίαι alone as an adv., perforce, Od., etc.; so, πρὸς βίαν τινός and πρὸς βίαν alone, Aesch.

div1.head: βιαρκής
div1.sense: supplying the necessaries of life, Anth.

div1.head: βιαστέος
div1.sense: one must do violence to, Eur.

div1.head: βιαστής
div1.sense: one who uses force, a violent man, NTest.

div1.head: βιάω
div1.sense: to constrain, Il.:— Pass. to be forcibly driven, of fire, Hdt.; θανάτωι βιηθείς overpowered, Hdt.

as Dep. in act. sense, to constrain, press hard, overpower, Hom.; βιήσατο κῦμʼ ἐπὶ χέρσου it forced me upon land, Od.; νῶϊ βιήσατο μισθόν he did us wrong in respect of our wages, Il.:— to force or urge on, Aesch.

div1.head: βιβάζω
div1.sense: Causal of βαίνω, to make to mount, to lift up, exalt, Soph.

div1.head: βιβάσθω
div1.sense: striding, Il.

div1.head: βιβάω
div1.sense: to stride, πέλωρα βιβᾶι he takes huge strides, Hhymn.; ἐβίβασκε, 3rd sg. Ionic imperf., Hhymn.; elsewhere in part., μακρὰ βιβῶντα, μακρὰ βιβῶσα Hom.

div1.head: βίβημι
div1.sense: to stride, only in part., μακρὰ βιβάς Il.

div1.head: βίβλινος
div1.sense: βίβλινος, οἶνος , Biblian wine, from Biblis in Thrace, Hes., Theocr.: βύβλινος in Eur.

div1.head: βιβλιοκάπηλος
div1.sense: a dealer in books, Luc.

div1.head: βιβλίον
div1.sense: a paper, scroll, letter, Hdt., Ar., etc.; often written βυβλίον.

div1.head: βίβλος
div1.sense: the inner bark of the papyrus (βύβλος): generally, bark, Plat.
a book, of which the leaves were made of this bark, Dem.

div1.head: βιβρώσκω
div1.etym: The Root is !βορ, v. βορά, Lat. voro.
div1.sense: to eat, eat up, βεβρωκὼς κακὰ φάρμακʼ Il.: c. gen. to eat of a thing, βεβρωκὼς βοός Od.:—Pass. to be eaten, χρήματα βεβρώσεται will be devoured, Od.

div1.head: βῖκος
div1.sense: Oriental word for a wine-jar, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: βινέω
div1.sense: coire, of illicit intercourse, Ar.

div1.head: βιοδότης
div1.sense: giver of life or food, Plat.

div1.head: βιόδωρος
div1.sense: life-giving, Poeta ap. Plat., Soph.

div1.head: βιοθάλμιος
div1.sense: lively, strong, hale, Hhymn.

div1.head: βιοθρέμμων
div1.sense: supporting the life, Ar.

div1.head: βιός
div1.sense: a bow, Il.

div1.head: βίος
div1.sense: life, i. e. not animal life (ζωή), but a course of life, manner of living, Lat. vita, Od., etc.; in pl., τίνες καὶ πόσοι εἰσὶ βίοι; Plat.
in Poets = ζωή, βίον ἐκπνεῖν Aesch.; ἀποψύχειν Soph.
life-time, Hdt., Plat.
a living, livelihood, means of living, substance, Lat. victus, Hes., Soph., etc.; τὸν βίον ποιεῖσθαι ἀπό τινος to make oneʼs living of a thing, Thuc., etc.
a life, biography, as those of Plut.

div1.head: βιοστερής
div1.sense: reft of the means of life, Soph.

div1.head: βιοτεία
div1.sense: a way of life, Xen.

div1.head: βιοτεύω
div1.sense: to live, Eur.
to get food, Thuc.: to live by or off a thing, ἀπὸ πολέμου Xen.

div1.head: βιοτή
div1.sense: = βίοτος, βίος, Od., Attic Poets.
a living, sustenance, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: βιότιον
div1.sense: a scant living, Ar.

div1.head: βίοτος
div1.sense: life, Il., Trag.
= βίος II, means of living, substance, Lat. victus, Hom.
the world, mankind, Anth.

div1.head: βιοφειδής
div1.sense: penurious, Anth.

div1.head: βιόω
div1.sense: to live, pass oneʼs life (whereas ζάω properly means to live, exist), Il., etc.; ἀπʼ αὐτῶν ὧν αὐτὸς βεβίωκεν from the very actions of his own life, Dem.; hence in Pass., τὰ σοὶ κἀμοὶ βεβιωμένα the actions of our life, Dem.; impers., βεβίωταί μοι I have lived, Lat. vixi, Dem.:—Mid. in act. sense, Hdt.

div1.head: βιώσιμος
div1.sense: to be lived, worth living, Eur.; οὐ βιώσιμόν ἐστί τινι ʼtis not meet for him to live, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: βίωσις
div1.sense: manner of life, NTest.

div1.head: βιώσκομαι
div1.sense: to quicken, make or keep alive, Od.

div1.head: βιωτέος
div1.sense: one must live, Plat.

div1.head: βιωτικός
div1.sense: of or pertaining to life, NTest.

div1.head: βιωτός
div1.sense: to be lived, worth living, Soph., Ar., etc.

div1.head: βλαβερός
div1.sense: hurtful, noxious, disadvantageous, Hes., Xen.

div1.head: βλάβη
div1.sense: hurt, harm, damage, opp. to wilful wrong (ἀδίκημα), Aesch., etc.:— βλ. τινός damage to a person or thing, φορτίων Ar.; but, βλάβη θεοῦ mischief from a god, Eur.:—of a person, ἡ πᾶσα βλάβη who is naught but mischief, Soph.
βλάβης δίκη an action for damage done, Dem., etc.

div1.head: βλαισός
div1.sense: having the knees bent inwards, bandylegged, Lat. valgus, Batr., Xen.:—generally, twisted, crooked, Anth.

div1.head: βλαίσωσις
div1.sense: distortion, retortion, Arist.

div1.head: βλακεία
div1.sense: laziness, stupidity, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: βλακεύω
div1.sense: only in pres., to be slack, lazy, Xen.
c. acc. to lose or waste through laziness, Luc.

div1.head: βλακικός
div1.sense: lazy, stupid, Plat.: adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: βλακώδης
div1.sense: lazy-like, lazy, Xen.

div1.head: βλάξ
div1.sense: slack in body and mind, stupid, a dolt, Plat., Xen.:—Sup. βλακίστατος.

div1.head: βλάπτω
div1.sense: to disable, hinder, stop Hom.:—βλ. πόδας to disable the feet, to lame them, Od.:—Pass., ὄζωι ἔνι βλαφθέντε the horses] caught in a branch, Il.; βλάβεν ἅρματα were stopped, Il.; Διόθεν βλαφθέντα βέλεμνα stopped, made frustrate by Zeus, Il.
c. gen. to hinder from, βλάπτουσι κελεύθου Od.:—Pass., βλαβέντα λοισθίων δρόμων arrested in its last course, Aesch.
of the mind, to distract, delude, deceive, mislead, of the Gods, Hom.; βλαφθείς, Lat. mente captus, Il.
after Hom. to damage, hurt, mar, opp. to wilful wrong (ἀδικεῖν), Aesch., etc.

div1.head: βλαστάνω
div1.sense: to bud, sprout, grow, of plants, Aesch., etc.
metaph. to shoot forth, come to light, of men; ἀνθρώπου φύσιν βλαστών born in manʼs nature, Soph.; βλαστάνει ἀπιστία Soph.
div1.etym: The Root is !βλαστ, v. βλαστεῖν, βλαστή.

div1.head: βλαστέω
div1.sense: late form of βλαστάνω, often introduced by Copyist for the aor2 forms βλαστεῖν, βλαστών.

div1.head: βλάστημα
div1.sense: = βλάστη I, Eur.
metaph. offspring, an offshoot, Aesch., Eur.
an eruption on the skin, Aretae.

div1.head: βλάστη
div1.sense: = βλαστός, Plat., etc.; πετραία βλ. the growing rock, Soph.
of children, βλάσται πατρός, birth from a father, Soph.; παιδὸς βλάσται its growth, Soph.

div1.head: βλαστός
div1.sense: a sprout, shoot, sucker, Lat. germen, Hdt.

div1.head: βλασφημέω
div1.sense: to drop evil or profane words, speak lightly or amiss of sacred things, βλ. εἰς θεούς Plat.: to utter ominous words, Aeschin.
to speak ill or to the prejudice of one, to speak slander, περί τινος Dem.; εἴς τινα Dem.:—also, βλ. τινα Babr., NTest.:—Pass. to have evil spoken of one, NTest.
to speak impiously or irreverently of God, to blaspheme, NTest.

div1.head: βλασφημία
div1.sense: a profane speech, opp. to εὐφημία, Eur., Plat.
defamation, evil-speaking, slander, Dem.
impious and irreverent speech against God, blasphemy, NTest.; τοῦ πνεύματος against the Spirit, NTest.; πρός τινα NTest.

div1.head: βλάσφημος
div1.etym: The origin of βλας is uncertain: βλάξ and βλάπτω have both been suggested.
div1.sense: evil-speaking: of words, slanderous, Dem.
speaking blasphemy, blasphemous, and as Subst. a blasphemer, NTest.

div1.head: βλαύτη
div1.sense: a kind of slipper worn by fops, Plat.

div1.head: βλάψις
div1.sense: a harming, damage, Plat.

div1.head: βλαψίφρων
div1.sense: mad, Aesch.

div1.head: βλεμεαίνω
div1.sense: to look fiercely, glare around, Il.

div1.head: βλέμμα
div1.sense: a look, glance, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: βλέπος
div1.sense: a look, Ar.

div1.head: βλεπτέος
div1.sense: one must look, Plat.

div1.head: βλεπτικός
div1.sense: of or for sight, Anth.

div1.head: βλεπτός
div1.sense: to be seen, worth seeing, Soph.

div1.head: βλέπω
div1.sense: to see, have the power of sight, Soph.; μὴ βλέπηι ὁ μάντις lest he see too clearly, Soph.

to look, εἴς τινα or τι, Aesch., etc.; πῶς βλέπων; with what face? Soph.;—with an adv., ἐχθρῶς βλ. πρός τινα Xen.:—foll. by a noun, φόβον βλ. to look terror, i. e. to look terrible, Aesch.; ἔβλεψε νᾶπυ looked mustard, Ar.; πυρρίχην βλέπων looking like a war-dancer, Ar.; πεφροντικὸς βλέπειν to look thoughtful, Eur.
to look to some one from whom help is expected, Soph.; εἴς τινα Soph., etc.:— of places, οἰκία πρὸς μεσημβρίαν βλέπουσα looking towards the south, Xen.
to look longingly, expect eagerly, c. inf., Ar.
to look to, ἑαυτούς NTest.; also, βλ. ἀπό τινος to beware of . . , NTest.; βλ. ἵνα .. to see that . . , NTest.

trans. to see, behold, c. acc., Trag.: βλ. φάος, φῶς ἡλίου to see the light of day, to live, Aesch., Eur.; and, without φάος, to be alive, live, Aesch., etc.; of things, βλέποντα actually existing, Aesch.

div1.head: βλεφαρίς
div1.sense: an eyelash, in pl. eyelashes, Lat. cilia, Ar., Xen., etc.

div1.head: βλέφαρον
div1.etym: γλέφαρον is variously listed as Doric and Aeolic.
div1.sense: mostly in pl. the eyelids, Hom.
the eyes, Trag.: ἁμέρας βλέφαρον, νυκτὸς βλέφαρον, i. e. the sun, the moon, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: βλέψις
div1.sense: sight, Plut.

div1.head: βλῆμα
div1.sense: a throw, cast, of dice, Eur.
a shot, wound, Hdt.
a coverlet, Anth.

div1.head: βλητέος
div1.sense: one must put, NTest.

div1.head: βλῆτρον
div1.sense: a fastening, a band or rivet, Il.

div1.head: βληχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bleat, of sheep and goats, Ar.; of infants, Ar.

div1.head: βληχή
div1.sense: a bleating, οἰῶν Od.: the wailing of children, Eur.

div1.head: βληχρός
div1.sense: weak, faint, slight, Plut.: cf. ἀ-βληχρός.

div1.head: βληχώδης
div1.sense: bleating, sheepish, Babr.

div1.head: βληχωνίας
div1.sense: prepared with pennyroyal, Ar.

div1.head: βλήχων
div1.sense: pennyroyal, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: βλιστηρίς
div1.sense: honey-taking, Anth.

div1.head: βλιτομάμμας
div1.sense: a booby, Ar.

div1.head: βλίττω
div1.etym: The Root is ΒΛΙΤ, β being in place of μ, cf. βλώσκω for μλώσκω).
div1.sense: to cut out the comb of bees, take the honey, Plat.:—metaph., βλ. τὸν δῆμον to rob the people of their honey, Ar.:—Pass., μέλι βλίττεται Plat.

div1.head: βλοσυρός
div1.sense: grim, fierce, Il.: terrible, Aesch.: bluff, burly, valiant, Plat.

div1.head: βλοσυρῶπις
div1.sense: grim-looking, Γοργώ Il.

div1.head: βλύζω
div1.sense: gush forth; c. dat., βλ. Λυαίωι with wine, Anth.

div1.head: βλύσις
div1.sense: a bubbling up, Anth.

div1.head: βλωθρός
div1.sense: tall, stately, of trees, Hom.

div1.head: βλώσκω
div1.etym: The Root is μολ, so that βλώσκω is for μολώσκω, μλώσκω; cf. θρώσκω from !θορ.
div1.sense: to go or come, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: βοάγριον
div1.sense: a shield of wild bullʼs hide, Il.

div1.head: βόαγρος
div1.sense: a wild bull.

div1.head: βόαμα
div1.sense: a shriek, cry, Aesch.

div1.head: βόαυλος
div1.sense: an ox-stall, Theocr.

div1.head: βοάω
div1.etym: a later form βοάσω in Eur. is aor1 subj
div1.sense: to cry aloud, to shout, Hom., Aesch.; οἱ βοησόμενοι men ready to shout (in the ἐκκλησία), Dem.
of things, to sound, resound, roar, howl, as the wind and waves, Il., Aesch.; αὐτὸ βοᾶι it proclaims itself, Ar.
c. acc. pers. to call to one, call on, Eur., Xen.
to call for, shout out for, Soph.
c. acc. cogn., β. βοάν, μέλος, etc., Ar., Soph.
to noise abroad, βεβωμένα ἀνὰ Ἰωνίην Hdt.; ἐβώσθησαν ἀνὰ τὴν Ἑλλάδα Hdt.
c. inf. to cry aloud or command in a loud voice to do a thing, Soph., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: βοείη
div1.sense: sc.βοείη δορή, an ox-hide, ox-hide shield, Hom.; gen. pl. βοῶν, contr. for βοέων, Il.

div1.head: βοεικός
div1.sense: of or for oxen, ζεύγη β. wagons drawn by oxen, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: βόειος
div1.sense: of an ox or oxen, esp. of ox-hide, Hom.; βόεα κρέα Hdt.; γάλα βόειον cows milk, Eur.; metaph., βόεια ῥήματα great bull- words (cf. βούπαις, etc.), Ar.

div1.head: βοεύς
div1.sense: a rope of ox-hide, Od.

div1.head: βοηγενής
div1.sense: born of an ox, of bees, Anth.

div1.head: βοηδρομέω
div1.sense: to run to a cry for aid, haste to help, Eur.

div1.head: Βοηδρόμια
div1.sense: games in memory of the succour given by Theseus against the Amazons, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: Βοηδρομιών
div1.sense: the third Attic month, in which the Βοηδρόμια were celebrated, answering nearly to our September, Dem.

div1.head: βοηδρόμος
div1.sense: running to a cry for aid, giving succour, a helper, Eur.: cf. βοηθόος.

div1.head: βοήθεια
div1.sense: help, aid, rescue, support, Thuc., etc.
medical aid, cure, Plut.
an auxiliary force, βοήθεια Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: βοηθέω
div1.sense: to come to aid, to succour, assist, aid, c. dat. pers., Hdt., Eur., etc.; πρός τινα Xen.
absol. to give aid, come to the rescue, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: βοηθητέος
div1.sense: one must help, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: βοηθόος
div1.sense: hasting to the battle-shout, hasting to battle, Il.; cf. βοηδρόμος.
aiding, helping, Pind.; and as Subst. an assistant, Theocr.

div1.head: βοηθός
div1.sense: assisting, auxiliary, Thuc.; and as Subst. an assistant, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: βοηλασία
div1.sense: a driving of oxen, cattle-lifting, Il.
a cattle-run, Anth.

div1.head: βοηλάτης
div1.sense: one that drives away oxen, a cattle-lifter, Anth.
ox-driving, Anth.

div1.head: βοηλατικός
div1.sense: of or for cattle-driving:— ἡ βοηλατική (sc. τέχνη) the herdsmanʼs art, Plat.

div1.head: βοή
div1.sense: a loud cry, shout, Hom., etc.:— a battle-cry, βοὴν ἀγαθός good at the battle-cry, Il.; βοᾶς μηδʼ ὄνομʼ ἔστω let there be not even the name of war, Theocr.:—also of the roar of the sea, Od.; of the sound of musical instruments, Il., Pind.; the cry of birds or beasts, Soph., Eur.;— ὅσον ἀπὸ βοῆς ἕνεκεν as far as sound went, only in appearance, Thuc., Xen.
= βοήθεια, aid called for, succour, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: βοητής
div1.sense: clamorous:— Doric fem. βοᾶτις Aesch.

div1.head: βοητύς
div1.sense: a shouting, clamour, Od.

div1.head: βόθρος
div1.etym: Prob. from the same Root as βαθύς: cp. also Lat. fodio.
div1.sense: any hole or pit dug in the ground, Lat. puteus, Hom.: a natural trough for washing clothes in, Od.:— a hole, such as a fire makes in the snow, Xen.

div1.head: βοῖ
div1.sense: like αἰβοῖ, exclam. of disgust, Ar.

div1.head: Βοιωταρχέω
div1.sense: to be a Boeotarch, Thuc.

div1.head: Βοιωτάρχης
div1.sense: a Boeotarch, one of the chief magistrates at Thebes, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: Βοιωταρχία
div1.sense: the office of Boeotarch, Plut.

div1.head: Βοιωτιάζω
div1.sense: to play the Boeotian, speak Boeotian, side with the Boeotians, Xen.

div1.head: Βοιωτία
div1.sense: Boeotia, so called from its cattle-pastures, Hes.

div1.head: Βοιώτιος
div1.sense: Boeotian: the Boeotians were proverbially clownish, whence the saying ὗς Βοιωτία.

div1.head: Βοιωτιουργής
div1.sense: of Boeotian work, Xen.

div1.head: Βοιωτός
div1.sense: a Boeotian, Il., etc.

div1.head: βολαῖος
div1.sense: violent, Trag. ap. Plut.

div1.head: βόλβα
div1.sense: the Lat. vulva, Anth.

div1.head: βολβός
div1.sense: a bulb: in Theocr. a truffle?

div1.head: βολή
div1.sense: a throw, the stroke or wound of a missile, opp. to πληγή (stroke of sword or pike), Od., Eur., Thuc.: βολαῖς σφόγγος ὤλεσεν γραφήν by its stroke or touch, Aesch.
metaph., like βέλος, a glance from the eyes, Od.
βολαὶ κεραύνιοι thunder- bolts, Aesch.; βολαὶ ἡλίου sun- beams, Soph.; βολὴ χιόνος a snow- shower, Eur.

div1.head: βολίζω
div1.sense: to heave the lead, take soundings, NTest.

div1.head: βολίς
div1.sense: a javelin, Plut.
a cast of the dice, a die, Anth.

div1.head: βολίτινος
div1.sense: of cow-dung, Ar.

div1.head: βόλιτον
div1.sense: cow-dung, mostly in pl., Ar.

div1.head: βολοκτυπίη
div1.sense: the rattling of the dice, Anth.

div1.head: βόλος
div1.sense: a throw with a casting-net, a cast, Orac. ap. Hdt., Theocr.: metaph., εἰς βόλον καθίστασθαι to fall within the cast of the net, Eur.
the thing caught, a draft of fish, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: βομβαύλιος
div1.sense: a bagpiper, with a play on βομβυλιός, Ar.

div1.head: βομβέω
div1.sense: to make a booming, humming noise, to sound deep or hollow, Hom.; βόμβησαν κατὰ ῥόον the oars fell with a loud noise down into the tide, Od.; βόμβησεν λίθος the stone flew humming through the air, Od.:—of bees, to hum, Theocr.; of mosquitoes, to buzz, Ar.

div1.head: βομβήεις
div1.sense: humming, buzzing, Anth.

div1.head: βομβητής
div1.sense: a hummer, buzzer, Anth.

div1.head: βόμβος
div1.sense: a booming, humming, Plat.

div1.head: βομβυλιός
div1.sense: an insect that hums or buzzes, a bumble-bee, Ar.

div1.head: βοοσφαγία
div1.sense: slaughter of oxen, Anth.

div1.head: βορά
div1.sense: eatage, meat, properly of carnivorous beasts, Trag.; of cannibal-like feast, Hdt., Trag.:—rarely of simple food, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: βορβορόθυμος
div1.sense: muddy-minded, Ar.

div1.head: Βορβοροκοίτης
div1.sense: mudcoucher, name of a frog, Batr.

div1.head: βόρβορος
div1.sense: mud, mire, Lat. coenum, Aesch., Ar., etc.

div1.head: βορβοροτάραξις
div1.sense: a mud-stirrer, mudlark, Ar.

div1.head: βορβορώδης
div1.sense: muddy, miry, Plat.

div1.head: Βορέας
div1.etym: Prob. from ὄρος, ϝόρος, wind from the mountains.
div1.sense: the North wind, Lat. Aquilo, Od.; πρὸς βορῆν ἄνεμον towards the North, Hdt.; πρὸς βορέαν τινός northward of a place, Thuc.

div1.head: βόρειος
div1.sense: from the quarter of the North wind, northern, Hdt.; ἀκτὰ β. exposed to the north, Soph.

div1.head: Βορηϊάς
div1.sense: a Boread, daughter of Boreas, Soph.

div1.head: βορός
div1.sense: devouring, gluttonous, Ar.

div1.head: βόρυες
div1.sense: unknown Libyan animals, Hdt.; cf. ὄρυες.

div1.head: Βορυσθενείτης
div1.sense: an inhabitant of the banks of the Borysthenes, Hdt

div1.head: Βορυσθένης
div1.sense: the Borysthenes or Dnieper, a river of Scythia, Hdt.

div1.head: βόσις
div1.sense: food, Il.

div1.head: βόσκημα
div1.sense: that which is fed or fatted: in pl. fatted beasts, cattle, Soph., etc.; of sheep, Eur.; of horses, Eur.; of pigs, Ar.
food, Aesch.

div1.head: βοσκή
div1.sense: fodder, food, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: βοσκητέος
div1.sense: one must feed, Ar.

div1.head: βοσκός
div1.sense: a herdsman, Anth.

div1.head: βόσκω
div1.sense: of the herdsman, to feed, tend, Lat. pasco, Od.
generally, to feed, nourish, support, of earth, Od.; of the Sun, Soph.; of soldiers, to maintain, Hdt., Thuc.: metaph., β. νόσον Soph.; πράγματα β. to feed up troubles, i. e. children, Ar.
Pass., of cattle, to feed, graze, Lat. pascor, Hom., c. acc.:— to feed on, Aesch.
metaph. to be fed or nurtured, Trag.; β. τινί or περί τι to run riot in athing, Anth. (The Root appears to be !βοτ, cf. βοτήρ, βοτός, βοτάνη.)

div1.head: Βόσπορος
div1.sense: ox-ford, name of several straits, of which the Thracian and Cimmerian are best known, Hdt.; also of the Hellespont, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: βοστρυχηδόν
div1.sense: like curls, Luc.

div1.head: βόστρυχος
div1.sense: a curl or lock of hair, Aesch., etc.
anything twisted or wreathed, πυρὸς β., of a flash of lightning, Aesch.

div1.head: βοτάμια
div1.sense: pastures, meadows, Thuc.

div1.head: βοτάνη
div1.sense: grass, fodder, Il., Plat.; ἐκ βοτάνης from feeding, from pasture, Theocr.

div1.head: βοτηρικός
div1.sense: of or for a herdsman, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: βοτήρ
div1.sense: a herdsman, herd, Od.; οἰωνῶν β. a soothsayer, Aesch.; κύων βοτήρ a herdsmanʼs dog, Soph.

div1.head: βοτόν
div1.sense: a beast, Aesch., Soph.: mostly in pl. grazing beasts, Il., Trag., etc.; but of birds, Ar.

div1.head: βοτρυδόν
div1.sense: like a bunch of grapes, in clusters, Il.

div1.head: βοτρύϊος
div1.sense: of grapes, Anth.

div1.head: βοτρυόδωρος
div1.sense: grape-producing, Ar.

div1.head: βοτρυόεις
div1.sense: clustering, Anth.

div1.head: βοτρυόπαις
div1.sense: grape-born, child of the grape, Anth.
act. bearing grapes, Theocr.

div1.head: βοτρυοχαίτης
div1.sense: with clustering hair, Anth.

div1.head: βότρυς
div1.sense: a cluster or bunch of grapes, Il., Attic
= βόστρυχος, Anth.

div1.head: βοτρυχώδης
div1.sense: like curls, curly, Eur.

div1.head: βοτρυώδης
div1.sense: like a bunch of grapes, Eur.

div1.head: βούβαλις
div1.sense: an African species of antelope, prob. the hartbeeste, Hdt.

div1.head: βούβοτος
div1.sense: grazed by cattle, Od.

div1.head: βούβρωστις
div1.sense: eating enormously: metaph. grinding poverty or misery, Il.

div1.head: βουβωνιάω
div1.sense: to suffer from swellings in the groin, Ar.

div1.head: βουβών
div1.sense: the groin, Lat. inguen, Il.

div1.head: βουγάϊος
div1.sense: a great bully or braggart, voc. βουγάϊε Hom.

div1.head: βουδόρος
div1.sense: flaying oxen, Hes.
as Subst. a knife for flaying, Babr.

div1.head: βουθερής
div1.sense: affording summer-pasture, Soph.

div1.head: βουθοίνης
div1.sense: beef-eater, Anth.

div1.head: βουθυσία
div1.sense: a sacrifice of oxen, Anth.

div1.head: βουθυτέω
div1.sense: to slay or sacrifice oxen, Soph., Eur.: generally to sacrifice any animals, Ar.

div1.head: βούθυτος
div1.sense: of or belonging to sacrifices, esp. of oxen, Aesch., Eur.
on which oxen are offered, sacrificial, Trag., Ar.

div1.head: βουκαῖος
div1.sense: cowherd, Theocr.

div1.head: βούκερως
div1.sense: horned like an ox or cow, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: Βουκεφάλας
div1.sense: the horse of Alexander the Great, Plut.

div1.head: βουκέφαλος
div1.sense: bull-headed, epith. of Thessalian horses, Ar.

div1.head: βουκολέω
div1.sense: to tend cattle, Il.:—Pass. of cattle, to range the fields, graze, Il
of persons, to tend, serve, worship, Ar.: Mid., τόνδε βουκολούμενος πόνον being constantly engaged in this toil, Aesch.
metaph. to delude, beguile, Aesch.; Mid., ἐλπίσι βουκολοῦμαι I feed myself on hopes, cheat myself with them, Eur.

div1.head: βουκόλημα
div1.sense: a beguilement, τῆς λύπης Babr.

div1.head: βουκολιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sing or write pastorals, Theocr.

div1.head: βουκολία
div1.sense: a herd of cattle, Hhymn., Hes.
a byre, ox-stall, Hdt.

div1.head: βουκολιαστής
div1.sense: a pastoral poet, Theocr.

div1.head: βουκολικός
div1.sense: pastoral, Theocr.

div1.head: βουκόλιον
div1.sense: a herd of cattle, Hdt., Theocr.
a means of beguiling, Anth.

div1.head: βουκόλος
div1.etym: -kolos is prob. an altered form of -πολος, cf. αἰπόλος.
div1.sense: a cowherd, herdsman, Hom., Plat.

div1.head: βουλαῖος
div1.sense: of the council: βουλαία, a name of Vesta, as having a statue in the Senate House, Aeschin.

div1.head: βουλαρχέω
div1.sense: to be a βούλαρχος, Arist.

div1.head: βούλαρχος
div1.sense: chief of the senate.
adviser of a plan, Lat. auctor consilii, Aesch.

div1.head: βούλευμα
div1.sense: a deliberate resolution, purpose, design, plan, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: βούλευσις
div1.sense: deliberation, Arist.
the wrongful enrolment of a person among the public debtors, Dem.

div1.head: βουλευτέος
div1.sense: one must take counsel, Aesch., Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: βουλευτήριον
div1.sense: a council-chamber, senate-house, Lat. curia, Hdt., Attic
the council or senate itself: and poet. a counsellor, Eur.

div1.head: βουλευτήριος
div1.sense: advising, Aesch.

div1.head: βουλευτής
div1.sense: a councillor, senator, Il., Hdt., etc.;—at Athens, one of the 500, Oratt.

div1.head: βουλευτικός
div1.sense: of or for the council or the councillors, Xen., Dem.
able to advise or deliberate, Plat., etc.
as Subst., βουλευτικόν, in the Athen. theatre, the seats next the orchestra, reserved for the Council, Ar.
the senatorial order, Plut.

div1.head: βουλευτός
div1.sense: devised, plotted, Aesch.

div1.head: βουλεύω
div1.sense: to take counsel, deliberate, concert measures, and in past tenses to have considered and so to determine, resolve:

absol., οἷος ἔην βουλευέμεν ἠδὲ μάχεσθαι such as he was in council and in battle, Od.; ἔς γε μίαν βουλεύσομεν sc. βουλήν we shall agree to one plan, Od.:—in Prose, this sense belongs chiefly to the Mid.

c. acc. rei, to deliberate on, plan, devise, Od., Hdt., Attic:—Pass. with fut. mid., aor1 ἐβουλεύθην: perf. βεβούλευμαι:— to be determined or resolved on, Aesch., etc.; τὰ βεβουλευμένα βουλεύματα, Hdt.
c. inf. to resolve to do, Od., Hdt.
to give counsel, τὰ λῷστα β. Aesch.; c. dat. pers. to advise, Il., Aesch.
in polit. writers, to be a member of Council, Hdt.; esp. of the Council of 500 at Athens, Plat., Xen., etc.
Mid., fut. -εύσομαι: aor1 ἐβουλευσάμην, Epic βουλ or in pass. form ἐβουλεύθην: perf. βεβούλευμαι:
absol. to take counsel with oneself, deliberate, Hdt., Attic
c. acc. rei, to determine with oneself, resolve on, Il., Hdt.
c. inf. to resolve to do, Hdt., Plat.; β. ὅπως . . , Xen.

div1.head: βουλήεις
div1.sense: of good counsel, Solon.

div1.head: βουλή
div1.sense: will, determination, Lat. consilium, esp. of the gods, Il., etc.
a counsel, piece of advice, plan, design, Il., Hdt., Attic:—in pl. counsels, Aesch.
a Council of the elders or chiefs, a Senate, Hom., Aesch.:—at Athens, the Council of 500 created by Cleisthenes, Hdt., Ar., etc.:— βουλῆς εἶναι to be of the Council, a member of it, Thuc.

div1.head: βούλησις
div1.sense: a willing: oneʼs will, intention, purpose, Eur., Thuc., etc.
the purpose or meaning of a poem, Plat.

div1.head: βουλητός
div1.sense: that is or should be willed: —τὸ β. the object of the will, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: βουληφόρος
div1.sense: counselling, advising, Il.; c. gen. a counsellor, Il.

div1.head: βουλιμία
div1.sense: ravenous hunger, a disease, Arist.

div1.head: βουλιμιάω
div1.sense: to suffer from βουλιμία, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: βούλιος
div1.sense: sage, Aesch.

div1.head: βούλομαι
div1.etym: The Root is !βολ, which appears in Epic βόλομαι, Lat.volo: hence βουλή.
div1.sense: Dep.

to will, wish, be willing, Hom., etc.:—mostly c. inf. or c. acc. et inf., Hom., etc.: when βούλομαι is foll. by acc. only, an inf. may be supplied, Τρώεσσιν ἐβούλετο νίκην he willed victory to the Trojans, or Τρώεσσιν ἐβούλετο κῦδος ὀρέξαι, — both in Il.
Attic usages:
βούλει or βούλεσθε foll. by subj., adds force to the demand, βούλει λάβωμαι would you have me take hold, Soph.
εἰ βούλει, a courteous phrase, like Lat. sis (si vis), if you please, Soph.
ὁ βουλόμενος, Lat. quivis, the first that offers, Hdt., Attic
βουλομένωι μοί ἐστι, nobis volentibus est, c. inf., it is according to my wish that . . , Thuc.
to mean so and so, τί βούλεται εἶναι; quid sibi vult haec res? Plat.:—hence, βούλεται εἶναι professes or pretends to be, would fain be, Thuc.
followed by ἤ, to prefer, for βούλομαι μᾶλλον, βούλομʼ ἐγὼ λαὸν σόον ἔμμεναι, ἢ ἀπολέσθαι I had rather the people were saved than lost, Il.

div1.head: βουλόμαχος
div1.sense: strife-desiring, Ar.

div1.head: βουλυτόνδε
div1.sense: towards even, at eventide, Hom.

div1.head: βουλυτός
div1.sense: the time for unyoking oxen, evening, Ar.

div1.head: βουμολγός
div1.sense: cow-milking, Anth.

div1.head: βουνίτης
div1.sense: a dweller on the hills, Anth.

div1.head: βουνοβατέω
div1.sense: to walk the hills, Anth.

div1.head: βουνοειδής
div1.sense: hilly, Plut.

div1.head: βούνομος
div1.sense: grazed by cattle, Soph.

div1.head: βουνόμος
div1.sense: ἀγέλαι βουνόμοι (parox.) herds of oxen at pasture, Soph.

div1.head: βουνός
div1.sense: a hill, mound, Hdt.

div1.head: βούπαις
div1.sense: a big boy, Ar.
(βοῦς, παῖς) child of the ox, of bees, in allusion to their fabulous origin, Anth.

div1.head: Βουπάλειος
div1.sense: like Bupalus, i. e. stupid, Anth.

div1.head: βούπαλις
div1.sense: wrestling like a bull, i. e. hard-struggling, Anth.

div1.head: βουπάμων
div1.sense: rich in cattle, Anth.

div1.head: βουπλάστης
div1.sense: cow-modeller, of the sculptor Myron, Anth.

div1.head: βούπληκτρος
div1.sense: goading oxen, Anth.

div1.head: βουπλήξ
div1.sense: an ox-goad, Lat. stimulus, Il.
an axe for felling an ox, Anth.

div1.head: βουποίμην
div1.sense: a herdsman, Anth.

div1.head: βουπόρος
div1.sense: ox-piercing, βουπ. ὀβελός a spit large enough to spit an ox, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: βούπρῳρος
div1.sense: with the face of an ox, Soph.

div1.head: βου-
div1.sense: prefix often used in compos. to express something huge and monstrous, e. g. βούπαις, βουγάϊος.

div1.head: βοῦς
div1.sense: Lat. bos (bov-is), a bullock, bull, ox, or a cow, in pl. oxen or kine, cattle, Hom., etc.
= βοείη or βοέη (always fem.), an ox-hide shield, Il.
proverb., βοῦς ἐπὶ γλώσσηι βέβηκε, βοῦς ἐπὶ γλώσσης ἐπιβαίνει, of people who keep silence from some weighty reason, from the notion of a heavy body keeping down the tongue, Theogn., Aesch.

div1.head: βούσταθμον
div1.sense: an ox-stall, Eur.

div1.head: βουστρόφος
div1.sense: ox-guiding, and as Subst. an ox-goad, Anth.

div1.head: βουσφαγέω
div1.sense: to slaughter oxen, Eur.

div1.head: βούτης
div1.sense: a herdsman, Aesch., Eur., Theocr.
as adj., βούτ. φόνος the slaughter of kine, Eur.

div1.head: βούτομον
div1.sense: butomus, the flowering rush, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: βουφάγος
div1.sense: ox-eating, Anth.

div1.head: βουφονέω
div1.sense: to slaughter oxen, Il.

div1.head: βουφόνια
div1.sense: sc. βουφόνια ἱερά a festival with sacrifices of oxen, Ar.

div1.head: βουφόνος
div1.sense: ox-slaying, ox-offering, Hhymn.
at or for which steers are slain, Aesch.

div1.head: βουφορβέω
div1.sense: to tend cattle, Eur.

div1.head: βουφόρβια
div1.sense: a herd of oxen, Eur.

div1.head: βουφορβός
div1.sense: ox-feeding, and as Subst. a herdsman, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: βουχανδής
div1.sense: holding a whole ox, Anth.

div1.head: βοώνης
div1.sense: at Athens, an officer who bought oxen for the sacrifices, Dem.

div1.head: βοῶπις
div1.sense: ox-eyed, i. e. having large, full eyes, mostly of Hera, Hom.

div1.head: βοωτέω
div1.sense: to plough, Hes.

div1.head: βοώτης
div1.sense: a ploughman, Babr.
the name given to the constellation Arcturus, Od.; v. ἄρκτος II.

div1.head: βραβεία
div1.sense: arbitration, judgment, Eur.

div1.head: βραβεῖον
div1.sense: a prize in the games, NTest.

div1.head: βραβεύς
div1.sense: the judge who assigned the prizes at the games, Lat. arbiter, Soph., Plat.
generally, an arbitrator, umpire, judge, Eur.: then a chief, leader, Aesch.: an author, Eur.

div1.head: βραβεύω
div1.sense: to act as a judge or umpire, Isocr.
c. acc. to arbitrate, decide on, τὰ δίκαια Dem.:— to direct, arrange, control, Anth.

div1.head: βράβυλον
div1.sense: a wild plum, Theocr.

div1.head: βραγχός
div1.sense: hoarse, Anth.

div1.head: βράγχος
div1.sense: hoarseness, or sore throat causing hoarseness, Thuc.

div1.head: βραδύνω
div1.sense: trans. to make slow, delay:— Pass. to be delayed, Soph.
intr. to be long, to loiter, delay, Soph.: so in Mid., Aesch.

div1.head: βραδυπειθής
div1.sense: slow to believe, Anth.

div1.head: βραδυπλοέω
div1.sense: to sail slowly, NTest.

div1.head: βραδύπους
div1.sense: slow of foot, slow, Eur.

div1.head: βραδυσκελής
div1.sense: slow of leg, Anth.

div1.head: βραδύς
div1.sense: slow, Hom., etc.:—c. inf., ἵπποι βάρδιστοι θείειν slowest at running, Il.; β. λέγειν Eur.:—adv., βραδέως χωρεῖν Thuc.
of the mind, like Lat. tardus, Il.; c. inf., προνοῆσαι βραδεῖς Thuc.; τὸ βραδύ slowness, Thuc.:—adv., βραδέως βουλεύεσθαι Thuc.
of Time, tardy, late, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: βραδυτής
div1.sense: slowness, Il., Attic
of the mind, Plat.

div1.head: βράκος
div1.sense: a rich womanʼs-garment, Theocr.

div1.head: βράσσω
div1.sense: to shake violently, throw up, of the sea, Anth.
to winnow grain, Plat.

div1.head: βράχεα
div1.etym: as if from a nom. βράχος, or βραχέα (neut. pl. of βραχύς)
div1.sense: shallows, Lat. brevia, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: βραχεῖν
div1.etym: found only in 3 sing. Epic aor2 ἔβραχε or βράχε
div1.sense: to rattle, clash, ring, of arms; of a torrent, to roar; of an axle, to creak; of one wounded, to shriek or roar, — all in Il.

div1.head: βραχιονιστήρ
div1.sense: an armlet, Plut.

div1.head: βραχίων
div1.sense: the arm, Lat. brachium, Il.; πρυμνὸς βραχίων the shoulder, Il.

div1.head: βραχύβιος
div1.sense: short-lived, Plat.

div1.head: βραχύβωλος
div1.sense: with small or few clods, Anth.

div1.head: βραχυγνώμων
div1.sense: of small understanding, Xen.

div1.head: βραχύδρομος
div1.sense: running a short way, Xen.

div1.head: βραχύκωλος
div1.sense: with short limbs or ends, Strab.
consisting of short clauses, περίοδοι Arist.

div1.head: βραχυλογία
div1.sense: brevity in speech or writing, Plat.

div1.head: βραχυλόγος
div1.sense: short in speech, of few words, Plat.

div1.head: βραχύνω
div1.sense: fut. υνῶ, to shorten, to use as a short syllable, Plut.

div1.head: βραχύπορος
div1.sense: with a short passage, Plat.
with narrow passage, Plut.

div1.head: βραχύς
div1.sense: short, Lat. brevis:
of Space and Time, Hdt., Attic; ἐν βραχεῖ (Ionic βραχέϊ) in a short time, briefly, Hdt., etc.; διὰ βραχέος Thuc.:—adv. βραχέως, scantily, seldom, Hdt.
of Size, short, small, little, Pind., Soph.; βρ. τεῖχος a low wall, Thuc.; κατὰ βραχύ little by little, Thuc.
of Quantity, few, διὰ βραχέων in few words, Plat.; διὰ βραχυτάτων Dem.:—adv., βραχέως, briefly, in few words, Xen.
of quality, humble, insignificant, Soph.:—of things, small, petty, trifling, Xen., etc.:—neut. as adv., βραχὺ φροντίζειν τινός to think lightly of, Dem.

div1.head: βραχυσύμβολος
div1.sense: bringing a small contribution, Anth.

div1.head: βραχύτης
div1.sense: shortness, Thuc.
narrowness, deficiency, Thuc.

div1.head: βραχύτονος
div1.sense: reaching but a short way, Plut.

div1.head: βραχυτράχηλος
div1.sense: short-necked, Plat.

div1.head: βραχύφυλλος
div1.sense: with few leaves, Anth.

div1.head: βρέγμα
div1.sense: the front part of the head, Lat. sinciput, Batr.

div1.head: βρεκεκεκέξ
div1.sense: formed to imitate the croaking of frogs, Ar.

div1.head: βρέμω
div1.sense: to roar, of a wave, Il.; so also in Mid., Il., Soph.
in later Poets, of arms, to clash, ring, Eur.; of men, to shout, rage, Aesch., Eur. to bear oneself haughtily, to hold oneʼs head high, swagger, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: βρέξις
div1.sense: a wetting, Xen.

div1.head: βρέτας
div1.sense: a wooden image of a god, Aesch., Eur., Ar.

div1.head: βρέφος
div1.sense: the babe in the womb, Lat. foetus: of an unborn foal, Il.
the new-born babe, Aesch., Eur.:—of beasts, a foal, whelp, cub, Hdt.:— ἐκ βρέφεος from babyhood, Anth.

div1.head: βρεχμός
div1.sense: the top of the head, Lat. sinciput, Il.

div1.head: βρέχω
div1.sense: Lat. rigo, to wet, τὸ γόνυ, of men walking through water, Hdt.:—Pass. to be wetted, get wet, βρεχόμενοι πρὸς τὸν ὀμφαλόν Xen.; βρέχεσθαι ἐν ὕδατι to bathe in water, Hdt.: of hard drinkers, βρεχθείς soaked, Eur.
to rain, send rain, NTest.; c. acc. cogn., βρ. πῦρ to rain fire, NTest.
impers. βρέχει, like ὕει, Lat. pluit, it rains, NTest.

div1.head: Βριάρεως
div1.sense: a hundred-handed giant, so called by the gods, but by men Aegaeon, Il.

div1.head: βριαρός
div1.etym: From same Root as βριθύς, βρίθω, βαρύς.
div1.sense: strong, stout, Il.

div1.head: βριάω
div1.sense: to make or to be strong and mighty, Hes. (v. βριαρός.)

div1.head: βρίζω
div1.sense: to be sleepy, to slumber, nod, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: βριήπυος
div1.sense: loud-shouting, of Ares, Il.

div1.head: βρῖθος
div1.sense: weight, Eur.

div1.head: βριθοσύνη
div1.sense: weight, heaviness, Il.

div1.head: βριθύνοος
div1.sense: grave-minded, thoughtful, Anth.

div1.head: βριθύς
div1.sense: weighty, heavy, Il, Irreg. comp. βριθύτερος, Aesch.

div1.head: βρίθω
div1.sense: to be heavy or weighed down with a thing, c. dat., of fruit-trees, Hom.; metaph., ὄλβωι βρίθειν Eur.; ξίφεσι βρ. to visit heavily with the sword, Eur.
c. gen. to groan with weight of a thing, σίτου, οἴνου Od.
absol. to be heavy, Il.; rare in Attic, βρίθει ὁ ἵππος sinks, Plat.
of men, to outweigh, prevail, ἐέδνοισι by gifts, Od.: absol. to have the preponderance in fight, to be master, prevail, Il.
trans. to weigh down, Aesch.:—Pass. to be laden, καρπῶι βριθομένη laden with fruit, Il.:—c. gen., βρίθεσθαι σταχύων Hes.

div1.head: βριμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to snort with anger, to be indignant, Ar.

div1.head: βρίμη
div1.sense: strength, bulk, Hhymn.

div1.head: βρισάρματος
div1.sense: chariot-loading, Hes.

div1.head: βρομέω
div1.sense: of flies, to buzz, Il.

div1.head: βρομιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.

div1.head: Βρόμιος
div1.sense: as a name of Bacchus, Aesch., Eur.; Βρομίου πῶμα, i. e. wine, Eur.
as adj. Βρόμιος, α, ον, Bacchic, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: βρόμος
div1.sense: Lat. fremitus, any loud noise, as the crackling of fire, Il.; roaring of a storm, Aesch.; neighing of horses, Aesch.
rage, fury, Eur.

div1.head: βροντάω
div1.sense: to thunder, Od.; metaph. of Pericles, Ar.
impers., βροντᾶι it thunders, Ar.

div1.head: βρόντημα
div1.sense: a thunder-clap, Aesch.

div1.head: βροντή
div1.sense: thunder, Hom., etc.
the state of one struck with thunder, astonishment, Hdt.

div1.head: βροντησικέραυνος
div1.sense: sending thunder and lightning, Ar.

div1.head: Βρόντης
div1.sense: thunderer, one of the three Cyclopes, Hes.

div1.head: βρότειος
div1.sense: mortal, human, of mortal mould, Trag.

div1.head: βροτοβάμων
div1.sense: trampling on men, Anth.

div1.head: βροτόγηρυς
div1.sense: with human voice, Anth.

div1.head: βροτόεις
div1.sense: gory, blood-boltered, Il.

div1.head: βροτοκτονέω
div1.sense: to murder men, Aesch.

div1.head: βροτοκτόνος
div1.sense: man-slaying, homicidal, Eur.

div1.head: βροτολοιγός
div1.sense: plague of man, bane of men, of Ares, Hom.

div1.head: βροτόομαι
div1.sense: Pass., to be stained with gore, Od.

div1.head: βροτοσκόπος
div1.sense: taking note of man, Aesch.

div1.head: βρότος
div1.sense: blood that has run from a wound, gore, Hom.

div1.head: βροτός
div1.etym: The orig. form seems to have been μορτός, cf. ἄμβροτος.
div1.sense: a mortal man, Hom., Attic Poets.

div1.head: βροτοστυγής
div1.sense: hated by men or man-hating, Aesch.

div1.head: βροτοφεγγής
div1.sense: giving light to men, Anth.

div1.head: βροτοφθόρος
div1.sense: man-destroying, Aesch.

div1.head: βροχετός
div1.sense: a wetting, rain, Anth.

div1.head: βροχή
div1.sense: rain, NTest.

div1.head: βρόχθος
div1.sense: the throat, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: βροχίς
div1.sense: Dim. of βρόχος, Anth.
(βρέχω) an ink-horn, Anth.

div1.head: βρόχος
div1.sense: a noose or slip-knot, for hanging or strangling, Od., Hdt., Soph.:— a snare for birds, Ar.:— the mesh of a net; metaph., ληφθέντες ἐν ταὐτῶι βρόχωι Aesch.

div1.head: βρόχω
div1.sense: to gulp down, a Root only found in aor1 ἔβροξα, Anth.:—used by Hom. only in compds.,
ἀναβρόξαι, to swallow again, suck down again, ὅτʼ ἀναβρόξειε ὕδωρ, of Charybdis, Od.; and in aor2 part. pass., ὕδωρ ἀναβροχέν Od.
καταβρόξαι, to gulp down, ὃς τὸ καταβρόξειε whoever swallowed the potion, Od.

div1.head: βρύκω
div1.sense: to eat with much noise, to eat greedily, Eur., Ar.:—metaph. to tear in pieces, devour, of a gnawing disease, Soph.; so in Pass., βρύκομαι, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: βρύλλω
div1.sense: to cry for drink, of children, Ar.

div1.head: βρῦν
div1.sense: in Ar. βρῦν εἰπεῖν to say bryn, cry for drink.

div1.head: βρύον
div1.sense: a kind of mossy sea-weed, Theocr.

div1.head: βρυχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to roar, bellow, Lat. rugire, of a bull, Soph., Ar.; of elephants, Plut.:—in Il. mostly of the death-cry of wounded men, κεῖτο βεβρυχώς; so, βρυχώμενον σπασμοῖσι, of Hercules, Soph.; δεινὰ βρυχηθείς Soph.:—in Od. of the roaring of waves. (Formed from the sound.) Hence

div1.head: βρυχηδόν
div1.sense: with gnashing of teeth, Anth.

div1.head: βρύχημα
div1.sense: bellowing, roaring, of men, Plut.

div1.head: βρυχητής
div1.sense: a bellower, roarer, Anth.

div1.head: βρύχιος
div1.etym: From *βρύξ, of which an acc. βρύχα occurs in late poets; cf. ὑποβρύχιος.
div1.sense: from the depths of the sea, Aesch.; of thunder from the deep, Aesch.

div1.head: βρύω
div1.sense: to be full to bursting:
c. dat. to swell or teem with, βρύει ἄνθεϊ teems with bloom, Il.:—metaph., βρύων μελίτταις καὶ προβάτοις Ar.; of men, θράσει βρύων Aesch.
c. gen. to be full of, βρύων δάφνης, ἐλαίας, ἀμπέλου Soph.: metaph., νόσου βρ. Aesch.
absol. to abound, grow luxuriantly, Soph.: of the earth, to teem with produce, Xen.
c. acc. cogn. to send forth water, NTest. (Akin to βλύω, βλύζω, and perh. to φλύω.)

div1.head: βρωμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bray, Lat. rudere, βρωμησάμενος Ar.

div1.head: βρῶμα
div1.sense: that which is eaten, food, meat, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: βρωματομιξαπάτη
div1.sense: the false pleasure of eating made dishes, Anth.

div1.head: βρώμη
div1.sense: food, Od.

div1.head: βρώσιμος
div1.sense: eatable, Aesch.

div1.head: βρῶσις
div1.sense: meat, Od., Thuc., etc.
eating, Plat.
corrosion, rust, NTest.

div1.head: βρωτήρ
div1.sense: eating, Aesch.

div1.head: βρωτός
div1.sense: to be eaten:— βρωτόν, meat, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: βύβλινος
div1.sense: made of byblus, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: βύβλος
div1.sense: the Egyptian papyrus, the root and triangular stalk of which were eaten by the poor, Hdt.
its fibrous coats, as prepared for ropes, Hdt.; cf. βύβλινος.
the outer coat of the papyrus, used for writing on, hence in pl. leaves of byblus, Hdt.
a paper, book, Hdt.; in this sense more commonly written βίβλος (q. v.):—pl. βύβλα, τά, Anth.

div1.head: βύζην
div1.sense: close pressed, closely, Thuc.

div1.head: βυθίζω
div1.sense: to sink a ship: metaph. to sink or ruin men, NTest.

div1.head: βύθιος
div1.sense: in the deep, sunken, Luc., Anth.
in or of the sea, τὰ βύθια (sc. ζῷα), water-animals, Anth.
metaph. of sound, deep, Plut.

div1.head: βυθῖτις
div1.sense: pecul. fem. of βύθιος, Anth.

div1.head: βυθός
div1.sense: the depth, esp. of the sea, the deep, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: βύκτης
div1.sense: swelling, blustering, βυκτάων ἀνέμων (Epic gen.) Od.

div1.head: βυνέω
div1.sense: to stuff, Ar.

div1.head: βυρσαίετος
div1.sense: leather-eagle, nickname of Cleon the tanner, Ar.

div1.head: βύρσα
div1.sense: the skin stripped off, a hide, Batr., Hdt.; βύρσης ὄζειν to smell of leather, Ar.: a drum, Eur.
the skin of a live animal, Theocr.

div1.head: βυρσεύς
div1.sense: a tanner, NTest.

div1.head: βυρσίνη
div1.sense: a leathern thong, Ar.

div1.head: βυρσοδεψέω
div1.sense: to dress or tan hides, Ar.

div1.head: βυρσοδέψης
div1.sense: a tanner, Ar.

div1.head: βυρσοπαγής
div1.sense: made of hides, Plut.

div1.head: βυρσοπαφλαγών
div1.sense: leather-Paphlagonian, nickname of Cleon, Ar.

div1.head: βυρσοπώλης
div1.sense: a leather-seller, Ar.

div1.head: βυρσοτενής
div1.sense: with skin stretched over it, of a drum, Eur.

div1.head: βύσσινος
div1.sense: made of βύσσος, σινδών β. a fine linen bandage, used for mummy-cloths,, Hdt.; for wounds, Hdt.; β. πέπλοι Aesch

div1.head: βυσσοδομεύω
div1.sense: to build in the deep: metaph. to brood over a thing in the depth of oneʼs soul, ponder deeply, Od.

div1.head: βυσσόθεν
div1.sense: from the bottom of the sea, Soph.

div1.head: βυσσομέτρης
div1.sense: measuring the deeps, epith. of a fisherman, Anth.

div1.head: βυσσός
div1.sense: the depth of the sea, the bottom, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: βύσσος
div1.etym: A foreign word; cf. Hebr. butz.
div1.sense: a fine flax, and the linen made from it, Theocr.

div1.head: βυσσόφρων
div1.sense: deep-thinking, Aesch.

div1.head: βύσσωμα
div1.sense: of nets, which stopped the passage of a shoal of tunnies, Anth.

div1.head: βύω
div1.sense: to stuff,
c. gen. rei, to stuff full of, only in Pass., νήματος βεβυσμένος stuffed full of spun-work or yarn, Od.; τὸ στόμα ἐβέβυστο sc. χρυσοῦ Hdt.
c. dat. rei, to stop or bung up with, plug: Pass., σπογγίωι βεβυσμένος Ar.
absol., βεβ. τὰ ὦτα deaf, Luc.

div1.head: βῶλος
div1.sense: a lump of earth, a clod, Lat. gleba, Od., Soph., Xen.
like Lat. gleba, land, ground, soil, Mosch., Anth.
generally, a lump of anything, a mass, of the sun, Eur.

div1.head: βωλοτόμος
div1.sense: clod-breaking, Anth.

div1.head: βώμιος
div1.sense: of an altar, Soph., Eur.
of a suppliant, βωμία at the altar, Eur.

div1.head: βωμίς
div1.sense: a step, Hdt.

div1.head: βωμοειδής
div1.sense: like an altar, Plut.

div1.head: βωμολόχευμα
div1.sense: a piece of low flattery, in pl. base flatteries, ribald jests, Ar.

div1.head: βωμολοχεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to use low flattery, indulge in ribaldry, Ar., Isocr.

div1.head: βωμολοχία
div1.sense: buffoonery, ribaldry, Plat.

div1.head: βωμολοχικός
div1.sense: inclined to ribaldry, Luc.

div1.head: βωμολόχος
div1.sense: properly one that lurked about the altars for the scraps that could be got there, a half-starved beggar, Luc.
metaph. one who would do any dirty work to get a meal, a lick-spittle, low jester, buffoon, Ar.:—as adj., βωμολόχον τι ἐξευρεῖν to invent some ribald trick, Ar.; of vulgar music, Ar.

div1.head: βωμός
div1.sense: any raised platform, a stand, Lat. suggestus, for chariots, Il.: of a statue, a base, pedestal, Od.
a raised place for sacrificing, an altar, Hom., Trag., etc.
a tomb, cairn, Anth.

div1.head: βωστρέω
div1.sense: to call on, esp. to call to aid, Od., Ar.

div1.head: βωτιάνειρα
div1.sense: man-feeding, nurse of heroes, Il.
